https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/normalised-difference-vegetation-index-1998-2020-raster-1
http://land.copernicus.eu/global/products/NDVI
Normalised Difference Vegetation Index 1998-2020 (raster 1 km), global, 10-daily - version 2
Normalised Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI) is widely used, dimensionless index indicative for vegetation density defined as NDVI=(NIR-Red)/(NIR+Red) where NIR corresponds to reflectance in near infrared bands, Red to reflectance in red band.

Normalised Difference Vegetation Index 2014-2020 (raster 300 m), global, 10-daily - version 1
Normalised Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI) is proxy to quantify vegetation amount. defined as NDVI=(NIR-Red)/(NIR+Red) where NIR corresponds to reflectance in near infrared band, and Red to reflectance in red band. closely related to FAPAR little scale dependant.

Lake Ice Extent 2021-present (raster 500 m), northern hemisphere, daily - version 1
Lake ice good climate indicator parameter in hydrological modelling weather prediction integration estimating dates for ice phenology events (ice break-up ice-off). Lake Ice Extent products classify ice for freshwater bodies per cloud-free pixel into fully snow covered ice (ii partially snow covered ice/clear ice (iii) open water.

31
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/hemispherical-albedo-1999-2020-raster-1-km-global-10
http://land.copernicus.eu/global/products/sa
Hemispherical Albedo 1999-2020 (raster 1 km), global, 10-daily - version 1
surface albedo quantifies fraction of irradiance reflected by surface of Earth. provides information on radiative basis, on temperature and water balance. hemispherical albedo or bi-hemispherical reflectance (also called white-sky albedo) is defined as integration of directional albedo over illumination hemisphere. assumes complete diffuse illumination.

39
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/lake-surface-water-temperature-2016-present-raster-1-km
https://land.copernicus.eu/global/products/
Lake Surface Water Temperature 2016-present (raster 1 km), global, 10-daily - version 1
Lake surface water temperature (LSWT) describes temperature lake surface, important indicator of lake hydrology biogeochemistry. Temperature trends observed over many years indicator of climate change affects lake. LSWT recognized internationally as Essential Climate Variable (ECV) complements water quality information, in environmental monitoring of large number of lakes globally.

https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/vegetation-condition-index-2013-2020-raster-1-km-global
http://land.copernicus.eu/global/products/vci
Vegetation Condition Index 2013-2020 (raster 1 km), global continents, 10-daily - version 1
Vegetation Condition Indicator (VCI) is categorical type of difference vegetation index. VCI compares observed NDVI to range of values observed in same period previous years VCI expressed in % gives idea where observed value situated between extreme values (minimum and maximum) in previous years. Lower and higher values indicate bad and good vegetation state conditions,.

https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/directional-albedo-1999-2020-raster-1-km-global-10-daily
http://land.copernicus.eu/global/products/sa
Directional Albedo 1999-2020 (raster 1 km), global, 10-daily - version 1
surface albedo quantifies fraction of irradiance reflected by surface of Earth. It provides information on radiative basis, on temperature and water balance. directional albedo or directional-hemispherical reflectance (also called black-sky albedo) is defined as integration of bi-directional reflectance over viewing hemisphere. It assumes all energy from direct radiation from sun and computed for local solar noon.

TOC Spectral reflectance refers to portion of incident energy reflected by surface in given spectral band without atmospheric interferences. of natural anisotropy of land surface, reflectance depends on illumination and viewing angular conditions., to compare and use jointly successive observations, necessary to normalize measurements into same angular configuration. resulting value is normalized TOC reflectance.

Fraction of Vegetation Cover (FCover) corresponds to fraction of ground covered by green vegetation.
 Practically, it quantifies spatial extent of vegetation. independent from
 illumination direction and sensitive to vegetation amount, FCover is good candidate
 for replacement of classical vegetation indices for monitoring of ecosystems.
 product at 333m resolution provided in Near Real Time and consolidated in next six periods.

Fraction of Absorbed Photosynthetically Active Radiation 1999-2020 (raster 1 km), global, 10-daily - version 1
FAPAR quantifies fraction of solar radiation absorbed by plants for photosynthesis. refers only to green and living elements of canopy. FAPAR depends on canopy structure, vegetation element optical properties, atmospheric conditions angular configuration. To overcome latter dependency, daily integrated FAPAR value is assessed. FAPAR useful as input to primary productivity models recognized as Essential Climate Variable (ECV) by Global Climate Observing System (GCOS).

EU-Hydro River Network Database 2006-2012 (vector), Europe - version 1.3, Nov. 2020
EU-Hydro is dataset for all EEA38 countries United Kingdom providing photo-interpreted river network, consistent surface interpretation of water bodies (lakes wide rivers), drainage model (also called Drainage Network), derived from EU-DEM, with catchments drainage lines nodes
 EU-Hydro dataset distributed in separate files (river network and drainage network) for each 35 major basins of EEA38 + UK area, in GDB and GPKG formats.
 production of EU-Hydro derived layers coordinated by European Environment Agency in EU Copernicus programme.

http://marine.copernicus.eu/services-portfolio/access-to-products/?option=com_csw&view=details&product_id=ARCTIC_MULTIYEAR_BGC_002_005
Arctic Ocean Biogeochemistry Reanalysis
description TOPAZ-ECOSMO reanalysis system assimilates satellite chlorophyll observations in situ nutrient profiles. model uses Hybrid Coordinate Ocean Model (HYCOM) coupled online to sea ice model ECOSMO biogeochemical model. uses Determinstic version of Ensemble Kalman Smoother to assimilate remotely sensed colour data nutrient profiles. Data assimilation including 80-member ensemble production performed every 8-days. Atmospheric forcing fields from ECMWF ERA-5 dataset used. DOI (product) :https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00006

83
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/dry-matter-productivity-2014-present-raster-300-m-global
https://land.copernicus.eu/global/products/dmp
Dry Matter Productivity 2014-present (raster 300 m), global, 10-daily - version 1
Dry matter Productivity (DMP) is indication of overall growth rate dry biomass increase of vegetation related to ecosystem Net Primary Productivity (NPP), its units (kilograms of gross dry matter per hectare per day) customized for agro-statistical purposes. Compared to Gross DMP (GDMP), or equivalent Gross Primary Productivity, main difference in inclusion of autotrophic respiration. Like FAPAR products input for GDMP estimation, GDMP products provided in Near Real Time, with consolidations in next periods or as offline product.

Dry matter Productivity (DMP) is indication of overall growth rate dry biomass increase of vegetation related to ecosystem Net Primary Productivity (NPP), its units (kilograms of gross dry matter per hectare per day) customized for agro-statistical purposes. Compared to Gross DMP (GDMP), or equivalent Gross Primary Productivity, main difference in inclusion of autotrophic respiration. Like FAPAR products input for GDMP estimation, GDMP products provided in Near Real Time, with consolidations in next six periods, or as offline product.

88
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/burnt-area-2020-present-raster-300-m-global-monthly
https://land.copernicus.eu/global/access
Burnt Area 2020-present (raster 300 m), global, monthly  - version 3
Burnt Area products map burn scars, surfaces affected by fire to display significant changes in vegetation cover (destruction of dry material, reduction loss of green material) and ground surface (temporarily darker because of ash). As fire can occur in any environmental context, properties of burnt surface may differ from place to place. identification is based on combination surface's properties and change detection, differences in spectral properties before and after fire occurance. burnt area detections provided at 333 m resolution.
---
89
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/fraction-absorbed-photosynthetically-active-radiation
http://land.copernicus.eu/global/products/fapar
Fraction of Absorbed Photosynthetically Active Radiation 2014-present (raster 300 m), global, 10-daily - version 1
FAPAR quantifies fraction of solar radiation absorbed by plants for photosynthesis. refers only to green and living elements of canopy.
 FAPAR depends on canopy structure, vegetation element optical properties, atmospheric conditions angular configuration.
 To overcome latter dependency, daily integrated FAPAR value is assessed. FAPAR useful as input to primary productivity models recognized as Essential Climate Variable (ECV) by Global Climate Observing System (GCOS).
 product at 333m resolution provided in Near Real Time consolidated in next six periods.
---

91
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/water-level-lakes-1992-present-vector-global-overpass
http://land.copernicus.eu/global/access
Water Level Lakes 1992-present (vector), global, per overpass - version 2
Water Level defined as height, in meters above geoid, of reflecting surface of continental water bodies observed by space radar altimeters measure time takes for radar pulses to reach ground targets, directly below spacecraft (nadir position), and return. only water bodies located along satellite's ground tracks can be monitored, with quality of measurement not depends of size of water body, but on reflecting targets in surroundings such as topography or vegetation. Water Level computed as time series over lakes and at intersections of rivers and satellite ground tracks.

Global Ocean Colour Plankton and Reflectances MY L3 daily observations

114
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/normalised-difference-vegetation-index-statistics-1999
https://land.copernicus.eu/global/access
Normalised Difference Vegetation Index Statistics 1999-2017 (raster 1 km), global, 10-daily - version 2
Normalised Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI) is proxy to quantify vegetation amount defined as NDVI=(NIR-Red)/(NIR+Red) NIR corresponds to reflectance in near infrared band Red to reflectance in red band. time series of dekadal (10-daily) NDVI 1km version 2 observations over period 1999-2017 used to calculate Long Term Statistics (LTS) for each of 36 10-daily periods (dekads) of year. calculated LTS include minimum, median maximum average standard deviation number of observations in covered time series period. These LTS used as reference for actual NDVI observations, allows evaluating vegetation conditions deviate from ?normal? situation.
---
115
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/fraction-vegetation-cover-1999-2020-raster-1-km-global-0
http://land.copernicus.eu/global/products/fcover
Fraction of Vegetation Cover 1999-2020 (raster 1 km), global, 10-daily - version 1
Fraction of vegetation Cover (FCOVER) corresponds to gap fraction for nadir direction. used to separate vegetation and soil in energy balance processes, including temperature and evapotranspiration. computed from leaf area index and other canopy structural variables does not depend on variables geometry of illumination as compared to FAPAR. For, good candidate for replacement of classical vegetation indices for monitoring of green vegetation. of linear relationship with radiometric signal, FCOVER only marginally scale dependent. Note similarly to LAI and FAPAR, only green elements will considered, belonging both to overstorey and understorey.
---
116
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/leaf-area-index-1999-2020-raster-1-km-global-10-daily
http://land.copernicus.eu/global/products/lai
Leaf Area Index 1999-2020 (raster 1 km), global, 10-daily - version 1
LAI defined by CEOS as half developed area of convex hull wrapping green canopy elements per unit horizontal ground. definition allows accounting for elements not flat such as needles or stems. LAI strongly non linearly related to reflectance. its estimation from remote sensing observations scale dependant over heterogeneous landscapes. When observing canopy of different layers of vegetation, mandatory to consider all green layers. particularly important for forest canopies where understory may represent significant contribution to total canopy LAI. derived LAI corresponds to total green LAI, including contribution of green elements of understory.
---

https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/small-woody-features-2018-raster-5-m-europe-3-yearly-may
https://land.copernicus.eu/pan-european/high-resolution-layers/small-woody-features/small-woody-features-2018?tab=download
Small Woody Features 2018 (raster 5 m), Europe, 3-yearly, May 2023
High Resolution land cover characteristics for 2018 reference year. Small woody landscape features are important vectors of biodiversity provide information on fragmentation of habitats with direct potential for restoration link to hazard protection green infrastructure, amongst. VHR_IMAGE_2018 available in ESA Copernicus DWH main data source for detection of small woody features identifiable within given image resolution. Small Woody Features (SWFs) layer contains woody linear and patchy elements not further differentiated into trees, hedges, bushes scrub. spatial pattern limited to linear structures isolated patches on basis of geometric characteristics.

Global Ocean OSTIA Sea Surface Temperature and Sea Ice Analysis
description Global Ocean- OSTIA global foundation Sea Surface Temperature product provides daily gap-free maps of Foundation Sea Surface Temperature at 0.05° x 0.05° horizontal grid resolution using in-situ satellite data from infrared microwave radiometers. OSTIA uses satellite data GHRSST project in-situ observations to determine sea surface temperature.
 high resolution (1/20° - approx. 6 km) daily analysis of sea surface temperature (SST) produced for global ocean some lakes. DOI (product) :https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00165

metadata refer 'Corine Land Cover + Backbone' (CLC) spatially detailed large scale Earth Observation-based land cover inventory CLC+ Backbone Raster Product 10m pixel land cover map Sentinel satelitte time series July 2017 to June 2019. each pixel shows dominant land cover 11 basic land cover classes.  1: Sealed
 2: Woody – needle leaved trees
 3: Woody Broadleaved deciduous trees
 4: Woody Broadleaved evergreen trees
 5: Low-growing woody plants (bushes shrubs)
 6: Permanent herbaceous
 7: Periodically herbaceous
 8: Lichens mosses
 9: Non- sparsely-vegetated
 10: Water
 11: Snow
 254: outside area
 255: No data product three years update cycle available 2018 reference year.

https://land.copernicus.eu/local/urban-atlas/street-tree-layer-stl/view
Urban Atlas Street Tree Layer 2012 (vector), Europe, 6-yearly, May 2016
Urban Atlas provides pan-European comparable land use land cover data for Functional Urban Areas (FUA). Street Tree Layer (STL) separate layer from Urban Atlas 2012 LU/LC layer within level 1 urban mask for each FUA. includes contiguous rows or patches of trees covering 500 m2 or more minimum width of 10 meter over "Artificial surfaces" (nomenclature class 1) inside FUA (i rows of trees along road network outside urban areas or forest adjacent to urban areas not included). 131
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/normalised-difference-vegetation-index-statistics-1999-0
https://land.copernicus.eu/global/access
Normalised Difference Vegetation Index Statistics 1999-2019 (raster 1 km), global, 10-daily - version 3
Normalised Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI) is widely used dimensionless index indicative for vegetation density defined as NDVI=(NIR-Red)/(NIR+Red) NIR corresponds to reflectance in near infrared bands Red to reflectance in red bands. time series of 10-daily NDVI 1km version 3 observations used to calculate Long Term Statistics (LTS), over 20-year period 1999-2019, and Short Term Statistics (STS), over 5-year period (2015-2019), for each of 36 10-daily periods (dekads) year. calculated statistics include minimum, median maximum mean standard deviation number of observations in covered time series period. statistics used as reference for actual NDVI observations allows monitoring of anomalous vegetation conditions.

133
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/snow-cover-extent-2018-present-raster-1-km-northern
https://land.copernicus.eu/global/products/sce
Snow Cover Extent 2018-present (raster 1 km), northern hemisphere, daily - version 1
Snow cover sensitive to changes in temperature (freezing/thaw) precipitation (snowfall, rain, hail) affects directly albedo energy balance of Earth?s surface relevant input parameter for weather forecasts climate change observations. Snow stores significant mass of water with high dynamic, strong effect on regional global energy and water cycles. Together with Snow Water Equivalent (SWE) product from passive microwave sensors, provides information on water content in snow on plain areas, up-to-date knowledge about snow cover extent important information for hydrological runoff modelling for assessing natural hazards such as flood events. Snow cover specified as Essential Climate Variable (ECV) by Global Climate Observing System (GCOS).
---

https://land.copernicus.eu/imagery-in-situ/european-image-mosaics/high-resolution/image-2009/image-2009-cov1
Pan-European High Resolution Image Mosaic 2009 - False Colour, Coverage 1 (20 m), May 2015
pan-European High Resolution (HR) Image Mosaic 2009 provides HR2 (High Resolution: 20 meter) coverage over Europe. surface covered by image dataset is 5.8 million square kilometres spatial resolution of 20 meters. imagery composed during specific acquisition windows between 2008 and 2010. Images derived from satellite sensors: Resourcesat-1
 SPOT-4/-5 mosaic used as input data in production of Copernicus Land Monitoring Service (CLMS) datasets and services land cover maps high resolution layers on land cover characteristic useful for CLMS users for visualizations classifications on land. input imagery for creation mosaic provided by ESA. Due to license restrictions, HR Image Mosaic 2009 only available as web service (WMS), not for data download.

143
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/leaf-area-index-2014-present-raster-300-m-global-10-daily
http://land.copernicus.eu/global/products/lai
Leaf Area Index 2014-present (raster 300 m), global, 10-daily - version 1
LAI defined by CEOS as half developed area of convex hull wrapping green canopy elements per unit horizontal ground. definition allows accounting for elements not flat such as needles or stems. LAI is strongly non linearly related to reflectance. its estimation from remote sensing observations scale dependant over heterogeneous landscapes. When observing canopy of different layers of vegetation, mandatory to consider all green layers. particularly important for forest canopies where understory may represent significant contribution to total canopy LAI. derived LAI corresponds to total green LAI, including contribution of green elements of understory. product at 333m resolution provided in Near Real Time and consolidated in next six periods.
---

https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/global-total-surface-and-15m-current-copernicus
http://marine.copernicus.eu/services-portfolio/access-to-products/?option=com_csw&view=details&product_id=MULTIOBS_GLO_PHY_REP_015_004
Global Total Surface and 15m Current (COPERNICUS-GLOBCURRENT) from Altimetric Geostrophic Current  and Modeled Ekman Current Reprocessing
Short description: product is REP L4 global total velocity field at 0m and 15m. consists of zonal and meridional velocity at 3h frequency 1/4 degree regular grid. total velocity fields obtained by combining CMEMS REP satellite Geostrophic surface currents and modelled Ekman currents at surface and 15m depth (using ECMWF ERA5 wind stress). 3 hourly product, daily and monthly means available. product initiated in CNES/CLS projects consolidated during Globcurrent project (funded by ESA User Element Program). 152
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/soil-water-index-2015-present-raster-1-km-europe-daily
https://land.copernicus.eu/global/products/swi
Soil Water Index 2015-present (raster 1 km), Europe, daily - version 1
Soil Water Index (SWI) quantifies moisture condition at various depths in soil mainly driven by precipitation via infiltration Soil moisture heterogeneous variable varies on small scales with soil properties and drainage patterns. Satellite measurements integrate over large-scale areas presence of vegetation adding complexity to interpretation. Soil moisture key parameter in environmental studies including hydrology, meteorology agriculture recognized as Essential Climate Variable (ECV) by Global Climate Observing System (GCOS). SWI product provides daily information about moisture conditions in different soil layers. includes quality flag (QFLAG) indicating availability of SSM measurements for SWI calculations, Surface State Flag (SSF) indicating frozen or snow covered soils.

description: For Global Ocean - product contains hourly Level-4 sea surface wind stress fields at 0.125 0.25 degrees horizontal spatial resolution. GLOBAL OCEAN L4 SIGNIFICANT WAVE HEIGHT FROM REPROCESSED SATELLITE MEASUREMENTS
description: Multi-Year gridded multi-mission merged satellite significant wave height. valid data included. product processed by WAVE-TAC multi-mission altimeter data processing system based on CMEMS Multi-Year level-3 SWH datasets (see product WAVE_GLO_PHY_SWH_L3_MY_014_005).
 merges along-track SWH data from missions: Jason-1, Jason-2 Envisat Cryosat-2 SARAL/AltiKa Jason-3 CFOSAT. resulting gridded product has 2° horizontal resolution produced daily. Different SWH fields produced: VAVH_DAILY fields are daily statistics computed from level 3 along-track measurements from 00 UTC until 23:59 UTC ; VAVH_INST field estimate of instantaneous wave field at 12:00UTC (noon), using Level 3 along-track measurements accounting for spatial and temporal proximity. GLOBAL OCEAN L4 SIGNIFICANT WAVE HEIGHT FROM NRT SATELLITE MEASUREMENTS
description: Near-Real-Time gridded multi-mission merged satellite significant wave height. valid data included. product processed-Time by WAVE-TAC multi-mission altimeter data processing system based on CMEMS level-3 SWH datasets (see product WAVE_GLO_WAV_L3_SWH_NRT_OBSERVATIONS_014_001).
 merges along-track SWH data from missions: Jason-3, Sentinel-3A, Sentinel-3B, SARAL/AltiKa Cryosat-2 CFOSAT HaiYang-2B. resulting gridded product has 2° horizontal resolution produced daily. Different SWH fields produced: VAVH_DAILY fields are daily statistics computed from level 3 along-track measurements from 00 UTC until 23:59 UTC ; VAVH_INST field estimate of instantaneous wave field at 12:00UTC (noon), using Level 3 along-track measurements accounting for spatial and temporal proximity. 175
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/leaf-area-index-1999-2020-raster-1-km-global-10-daily-0
http://land.copernicus.eu/global/products/lai
Leaf Area Index 1999-2020 (raster 1 km), global, 10-daily - version 2
LAI defined by CEOS as half developed area of convex hull wrapping green canopy elements per unit horizontal ground. definition allows accounting for elements not flat such as needles or stems. LAI strongly non linearly related to reflectance. its estimation from remote sensing observations scale dependant over heterogeneous landscapes. When observing canopy of different layers of vegetation, mandatory to consider all green layers. particularly important for forest canopies where understory may represent significant contribution to total canopy LAI. derived LAI corresponds to total green LAI, including contribution of green elements of understory. resulting GEOV1 LAI products consistent with actual LAI for low LAI values and ?non-forest? surfaces; for forests, particularly for needle leaf types, significant departures with true LAI are expected.
---

https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/high-resolution-vegetation-phenology-and-productivity-3
https://www.wekeo.eu/data?view=viewer&t=1566840390697&z=0&center=13.08408%2C48.33915&zoom=12.34&%3D&initial=1
High Resolution Vegetation Phenology and Productivity: Leaf Area Index (raster 10m) version 1 revision 1, Sep. 2021
metadata refers to Leaf Area Index (LAI) dataset, near real-time (NRT) Vegetation Index products of pan-European High Resolution Vegetation Phenology and Productivity (HR-VPP), component of Copernicus Land Monitoring Service (CLMS). Leaf Area Index (LAI) defined as half total area of green elements of canopy per unit horizontal ground area satellite-derived value corresponds to total green LAI of all canopy layers including understory significant contribution, particularly for forests. LAI dataset available as raster files with 10 x 10m resolution in UTM/WGS84 projection to Sentinel-2 tiling grid for tiles cover EEA38 countries and United Kingdom for period from October 2016 until today with daily updates. Each file has associated quality indicator (QFLAG2) to assist users with screening of clouds, shadows from clouds topography, snow water surfaces.

177
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/high-resolution-vegetation-phenology-and-productivity-0
https://www.wekeo.eu/data?view=viewer&t=1566840390697&z=0&center=13.08408%2C48.33915&zoom=12.34&&initial=1
High Resolution Vegetation Phenology and Productivity: Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (raster 10m) - version 1 revision 1, Sep. 2021
metadata refers to Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI) dataset, near real-time (NRT) Vegetation Index products of pan-European High Resolution Vegetation Phenology and Productivity (HR-VPP), component of Copernicus Land Monitoring Service (CLMS). Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI) is widely used dimensionless vegetation index indicative for vegetation density defined as NDVI=(NIR-Red)/(NIR+Red) NIR corresponds to reflectance in near infrared band Red to reflectance in red bands. NDVI dataset available as raster files with 10 x 10m resolution in UTM/WGS84 projection to Sentinel-2 tiling grid for tiles cover EEA38 countries and United Kingdom for period from October 2016 until today with daily updates. Each file has associated quality indicator (QFLAG2) to assist with screening of clouds, shadows from clouds topography, snow water surfaces.

178
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/surface-soil-moisture-2014-present-raster-1-km-europe
https://land.copernicus.eu/global/products/ssm
Surface Soil Moisture 2014-present (raster 1 km), Europe, daily  - version 1
Surface Soil Moisture (SSM) is relative water content of top few centimetres soil, describing how wet or dry soil in topmost layer, expressed in percent saturation. measured by satellite radar sensors allows insights in local precipitation impacts soil conditions.
 SSM is key driver of water and heat fluxes between ground and atmosphere, regulating air temperature humidity. role as water supply vital to vegetation health. SSM sensitive to external forcing in of precipitation, temperature solar irradiation humidity wind. SSM is integrator of climatic conditions and driver of local weather and climate, plays major role in global water-, energy- carbon- cycles.
 Knowledge on dynamics of soil moisture important in understanding of processes in many environmental and socio-economic fields, e.g. its impact on vegetation vitality crop yield droughts exposure to flood threats.
---

Global Ocean- in-situ Near real time observations of ocean currents
description
 product dedicated to ocean current data observed in near-real time. Current data from 3 types instruments distributed:
 * near-surface zonal and meridional velocities calculated along trajectories drifting buoys part of DBCP’s Global Drifter Program. data delivered together with wind stress components surface temperature.
 * near-surface zonal and meridional total velocities near-surface radial velocities measured by High Frequency radars part of European High Frequency radar Network. data delivered together with standard deviation of near meridional raw velocities, Geometrical Dilution of Precision (GDOP), quality flags metadata.
 * zonal and meridional velocities at parking depth and in surface calculated along trajectories of floats part of Argo Program. DOI (product) :https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00041 https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00041

 wave reanalysis for Black Sea produced with third generation spectral wave model WAM Cycle 6. reanalysis produced on HPC at Helmholtz-Zentrum Hereon continuously updated every six months covering period since January 1979. shallow water Black Sea version implemented on spherical grid with spatial resolution 2.5 km (1/40° x 1/40°) with 24 directional 30 frequency bins. active wave model grid points is 74518. model wave breaking assimilation of Jason satellite wave wind data. system provides one-hourly output atmospheric forcing taken from ECMWF ERA5 data. High Resolution Vegetation Phenology and Productivity: Fraction of Absorbed Photosynthetically Active Radiation (raster 10m) version 1 revision 1, Sep. 2021
metadata refers to Fraction of Absorbed Photosynthetically Active Radiation (FAPAR) dataset, near real-time (NRT) Vegetation Index products of pan-European High Resolution Vegetation Phenology and Productivity (HR-VPP), component of Copernicus Land Monitoring Service (CLMS). Fraction of Absorbed Photosynthetically Active Radiation (FAPAR) quantifies fraction solar radiation absorbed by live leaves for photosynthesis activity refers only to green and alive elements of canopy FAPAR depends on canopy structure, vegetation element optical properties illumination conditions. FAPAR dataset available as raster files with 10 x 10m resolution in UTM/WGS84 projection to Sentinel-2 tiling grid for tiles cover EEA38 countries United Kingdom for period from October 2016 until today with daily updates. 192
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/arctic-ocean-physics-reanalysis
http://marine.copernicus.eu/services-portfolio/access-to-products/?option=com_csw&view=details&product_id=ARCTIC_MULTIYEAR_PHY_002_003
Arctic Ocean Physics Reanalysis
description: current version TOPAZ system - TOPAZ4b - nearly identical to real-time forecast system at MET Norway. uses recent Hybrid Coordinate Ocean Model (HYCOM) developed at University of Miami (Bleck 2002). HYCOM coupled to sea ice model; ice thermodynamics described in Drange and Simonsen (1996) elastic-viscous-plastic rheology in Hunke and Dukowicz (1997). model's native grid covers Arctic and North Atlantic Oceans homogeneous horizontal spacing (between 11 and 16 km). 50 hybrid layers used in vertical (z-isopycnal), more than TOPAZ4 system (28 layers). TOPAZ4b uses Deterministic version Ensemble Kalman filter (DEnKF; Sakov and Oke 2008) to assimilate remotely sensed temperature and salinity profiles. output interpolated onto standard grids and depths. Daily values provided at all depths. Data assimilation including 100-member ensemble production, performed weekly. DOI (product) :https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00007
---
193
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/mediterranean-sea-ocean-colour-plankton-my-l4-daily
http://marine.copernicus.eu/services-portfolio/access-to-products/?option=com_csw&view=details&product_id=OCEANCOLOUR_MED_BGC_L4_MY_009_144
Mediterranean Sea Ocean Colour Plankton MY L4 daily gapfree observations and climatology and monthly observations
description Mediterranean Sea Ocean Satellite Observations Italian National Research Council (CNR – Rome, Italy), providing multi-years Bio-Geo_Chemical (BGC) regional datasets:
 * ''plankton'' phytoplankton chlorophyll concentration (CHL) evaluated region-specific algorithms (Case 1 waters Volpe et al., 2019 new coefficients; Case 2 waters Berthon and Zibordi, 2004), interpolated gap-free Chl concentration ""cloud free"" product) estimated modified version DINEOF algorithm (Volpe et al., 2018); daily climatology for chlorophyll concentration provided. Upstreams: SeaWiFS, MODIS, MERIS, VIIRS-SNPP JPSS1, OLCI-S3A ""multi"" products OLCI-S3A & S3B ""olci"" products Temporal resolutions: monthly daily"gap-free"" climatology data) Spatial resolution: 1 km for ""multi"" 300 meters for ""olci"" find product catalogue use search keyword ""OCEANCOLOUR_MED_BGC_L4_MY"". DOI (product) :https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00300 https://doi.48670/moi-00300

194
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/global-ocean-waves-reanalysis
http://marine.copernicus.eu/services-portfolio/access-to-products/?option=com_csw&view=details&product_id=GLOBAL_MULTIYEAR_WAV_001_032
Global Ocean Waves Reanalysis
Short description: GLOBAL_REANALYSIS_WAV_001_032 for global wave reanalysis describing past sea states since 1993. product also bears name of WAVERYS within GLO-HR MFC. for correspondence to other global multi-year products like GLORYS. BIORYS. core of WAVERYS based on MFWAM model. third generation wave model calculates wave spectrum distribution of sea state energy in frequency direction on 1/5° irregular grid. Average wave quantities from wave spectrum SWH (significant wave height) or average wave period delivered on regular 1/5° grid with 3h time step. wave spectrum discretized into 30 frequencies from geometric sequence of first member 0.035 Hz and reason 7.5. WAVERYS account oceanic currents from GLORYS12 physical ocean reanalysis assimilates significant wave height from historical altimetry missions and directional wave spectra from Sentinel 1 SAR from 2017 onwards. DOI (product):https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00022.48670-00022
---
195
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/provider-c3s-data-rescue-without
https://cds.climate.copernicus.eu/cdsapp#!/dataset/provider-c3s-data-rescue-without
provider-c3s-data-rescue-without
present Catalogue entry introduces Data Rescue Service online portal run by contract team coordinated by Copernicus Climate Change Service (C3S).
 Registration with login to C3S Data Rescue Service portal independent of present C3S Climate Data Store catalogue. Data Rescue Service online portal Data rescue is discovery preservation quality control digitisation consolidation of past measurements of weather conditions.
 C3S Data Rescue Service not provide rescued data - data sent to international repositories. facilitates coordinates rescue of weather climate data from around world.
 service collects shares information on past current planned data rescue projects feeds data into international repositories promotes tools, best practice standards for aspects data rescue process.
 .dataset-main-column{width:100%} .dataset-additional-block{display:none} .dataset-details-panel table {width:100%;font-size:0.9em} -details-panel table td {vertical-align:middle}

196
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/urban-atlas-street-tree-layer-2018-vector-europe-6-yearly
https://land.copernicus.eu/local/urban-atlas/street-tree-layer-stl-2018
Urban Atlas Street Tree Layer 2018 (vector), Europe, 6-yearly, Feb. 2021
Urban Atlas provides pan-European comparable land use land cover data for Functional Urban Areas (FUA) across EEA38 countries (EU, EFTA, Western Balkan countries Türkiye) and United Kingdom. Street Tree Layer (STL) is separate layer from Urban Atlas 2018 LU/LC layer produced within level 1 urban mask for each FUA. includes contiguous rows or patches of trees covering 500 m2 or more minimum width of 10 meter over "Artificial surfaces" (nomenclature class 1) inside FUA (i rows of trees along road network outside urban areas or forest adjacent to urban areas not included). Urban Atlas is joint initiative of European Commission Directorate-General for Regional and Urban Policy Directorate-General for Defence Industry and Space in EU Copernicus programme with support of European Space Agency European Environment Agency. NOTE: not all FUAs available for download through Copernicus Land Monitoring Service website. last FUAs added in February 2021.

https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/nutrient-and-carbon-profiles-vertical-distribution
http://marine.copernicus.eu/services-portfolio/access-to-products/?option=com_csw&view=details&product_id=MULTIOBS_GLO_BGC_NUTRIENTS_CARBON_PROFILES_MYNRT_015_009
Nutrient and carbon profiles vertical distribution
description product consists of vertical profiles of concentration of nutrients (nitrates phosphates silicates) carbonate system variables (total alkalinity dissolved inorganic carbon pH partial pressure of carbon dioxide), computed for each Argo float equipped with oxygen sensor.
 method CANYON (Carbonate system Nutrients concentration from hYdrological properties Oxygen using Neural-network) based on neural network trained using high-quality nutrient data collected over last 30 years (GLODAPv2 database, https://www.glodap.info/). method applied to each Argo float oxygen sensor using input properties measured float (pressure temperature salinity oxygen), date position. https://www.glodap.info/ Product Citation: refer to Technical FAQ for citing products: http://marine.copernicus.eu/faq/cite-cmems-products-cmems-credit/?idpag.... http://marine/faq/cite-cmems-products-cmems-credit?idpag... DOI (product) :https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00048.48670/moi-00048

198
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/imperviousness-classified-change-2009-2012-raster-20-m
https://land.copernicus.eu/pan-european/high-resolution-layers/imperviousness/change-maps/2009-2012/classified-change/view
Imperviousness Classified Change 2009-2012 (raster 20 m), Europe, 3-yearly, Apr. 2018
high resolution imperviousness products capture percentage change of soil sealing. Built-up areas characterized by substitution of original natural land cover or water surface with artificial often impervious cover artificial surfaces maintained over long periods time. series of high resolution imperviousness datasets (for 2006, 2009, 2012 2015 reference years) with artificially sealed areas produced using automatic derivation based on calibrated Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI). series imperviousness layers constitutes main status layers. are per-pixel estimates of impermeable cover soil (soil sealing) mapped as degree of imperviousness (0-100%). Imperviousness change layers produced as difference between reference years (2006-2009 2009-2012 2012-2015 2006-2012 match CORINE Land Cover production cycle) presented 1) as degree of imperviousness change (-100% -- +100%), in 20m and 100m pixel size 2) classified (categorical) 20m change product.

202
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/global-ocean-physics-reanalysis
http://marine.copernicus.eu/services-portfolio/access-to-products/?option=com_csw&view=details&product_id=GLOBAL_MULTIYEAR_PHY_001_030
Global Ocean Physics Reanalysis
description GLORYS12V1 product is CMEMS global ocean eddy-resolving (1/12° horizontal resolution, 50 vertical levels) reanalysis covering altimetry (1993 onward). based on current real-time global forecasting CMEMS system. model component is NEMO platform driven at surface by ECMWF ERA-Interim ERA5 reanalyses for recent years. Observations assimilated by reduced-order Kalman filter. track altimeter data (Sea Level Anomaly), Satellite Sea Surface Temperature, Sea Ice Concentration In situ Temperature and Salinity vertical Profiles are assimilated. 3D-VAR scheme provides correction for large-scale biases in temperature and salinity. product includes daily and monthly mean files for temperature, salinity currents sea level mixed layer depth ice parameters from top to bottom. global ocean output files displayed on standard regular grid at 1/12° (approximatively 8 km) on 50 standard levels. DOI (product) :https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00021
---
203
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/arctic-ocean-sea-ice-analysis-and-forecast
http://marine.copernicus.eu/services-portfolio/access-to-products/?option=com_csw&view=details&product_id=ARCTIC_ANALYSISFORECAST_PHY_ICE_002_011
Arctic Ocean Sea Ice Analysis and Forecast
Description Arctic Sea Ice Analysis and Forecast system uses neXtSIM sea ice model running Brittle-Bingham-Maxwell sea ice rheology on adaptive triangular mesh of 10 km average cell length. model domain covers whole Arctic domain including Canadian Archipelago, Baffin and Hudson Bays. neXtSIM forced with surface atmosphere forcings from ECMWF (European for) and ocean forcings from TOPAZ5, ARC MFC PHY NRT system (002_001a). neXtSIM runs daily assimilating OSI-SAF sea ice concentrations SSMI and AMSR2) from SI TAC with manual ice charts providing 7-day forecasts. output variables are ice concentrations, ice thickness ice drift velocity snow depths sea ice type, ridge area fractoin albedo provided at hourly frequency. adaptive Lagrangian mesh interpolated on 3 km resolution regular grid in Polar Stereographic projection. projection identical to other ARC MFC products. DOI (product) : https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00004
---
204
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/black-sea-physics-reanalysis
http://marine.copernicus.eu/services-portfolio/access-to-products/?option=com_csw&view=details&product_id=BLKSEA_MULTIYEAR_PHY_007_004
Black Sea Physics Reanalysis
description BLKSEA_MULTIYEAR_PHY_007_004 product provides monthly daily ocean fields for Black Sea basin starting from 01/01/1993 hydrodynamical core based on NEMO general circulation ocean model implemented in BS domain with horizontal resolution 1/27° x 1/36° 31 vertical levels. NEMO forced by atmospheric surface fluxes computed by bulk formulation using ECMWF ERA5 atmospheric fields at resolution 0.25° in space 1-h in time. current version has closed boundary at Bosporus Strait. model online coupled to OceanVar assimilation scheme assimilate sea level anomaly along-track observations from CMEMS available in situ vertical profiles of temperature salinity from SeaDataNet CMEMS datasets. Product Citation:
 refer to Technical FAQ for citing products. http://marine.copernicus.eu/faq/cite-cmems-products-cmems-credit/?idpag...?idpag... DOI (Product):https://doi.org/10.25423/CMCC/BLKSEA_MULTIYEAR_PHY_007_004 https://doi

Black Sea Ocean Colour Plankton and Transparency NRT L4 daily and monthly observations
description Black Sea Ocean Satellite Observations Italian National Research Council (CNR – Rome, Italy), providing Bio-Geo_Chemical (BGC) regional datasets
 * ''plankton'' phytoplankton chlorophyll concentration (CHL) evaluated region-specific algorithms (Zibordi et al., 2015; Kajiyama et al., 2018) interpolated gap-free Chl concentration"cloud free"" product) estimated modified DINEOF algorithm (Volpe et al., 2018)
 ''transparency'' diffuse attenuation coefficient light at 490 nm (KD490) (for ""multi"" observations achieved region-specific algorithm, Volpe et al., 2019) Upstreams: SeaWiFS, MODIS, MERIS, VIIRS-SNPP JPSS1, OLCI-S3A & S3B for ""multi"" products OLCI-S3A & S3B ""olci"" products Temporal resolutions: monthly daily ""gap-free"" data) Spatial resolutions: 1 km for ""multi"" 300 meters for ""olci"" find product catalogue use search keyword ""OCEANCOLOUR_BLK_BGC_L4_NRT"". Imperviousness Change 2006-2009 (raster 20 m), Europe, 3-yearly, Apr. 2018
high resolution imperviousness products capture percentage change of soil sealing. Built-up areas characterized by substitution of original natural land cover or water surface with artificial often impervious cover artificial surfaces maintained over long periods time. series of high resolution imperviousness datasets (for 2006, 2009, 2012, 2015 2018 reference years) with artificially sealed areas produced using automatic derivation based on calibrated Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI). series imperviousness layers constitutes main status layers. per-pixel estimates of impermeable cover soil (soil sealing) mapped as degree of imperviousness (0-100%). 217
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/imperviousness-change-2006-2009-raster-100-m-europe-3
https://land.copernicus.eu/pan-european/high-resolution-layers/imperviousness/change-maps/2006-2009/degree-change/view
Imperviousness Change 2006-2009 (raster 100 m), Europe, 3-yearly, Apr. 2018
high resolution imperviousness products capture percentage change of soil sealing. Built-up areas characterized by substitution of original natural land cover or water surface with artificial often impervious cover artificial surfaces maintained over long periods time. series of high resolution imperviousness datasets (for 2006, 2009, 2012, 2015 2018 reference years) with artificially sealed areas produced using automatic derivation based on calibrated Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI). series imperviousness layers constitutes main status layers. per-pixel estimates of impermeable cover soil (soil sealing) mapped as degree of imperviousness (0-100%). Imperviousness change layers produced as difference between reference years (2006-2009, 2009-2012 2012-2015 2015-2018 2006-2012 match CORINE Land Cover production cycle) presented 1) as degree of imperviousness change (-100% -- +100%), in 20m and 100m pixel size 2) classified (categorical) 20m change product.
---

222
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/sar-sea-ice-berg-concentration-and-individual-icebergs
http://marine.copernicus.eu/services-portfolio/access-to-products/?option=com_csw&view=details&product_id=SEAICE_ARC_SEAICE_L4_NRT_OBSERVATIONS_011_007
SAR Sea Ice Berg Concentration and Individual Icebergs Observed with Sentinel-1
description: iceberg product contains 4 datasets (IW and EW modes and mosaic for two modes) describing iceberg concentration as number of icebergs counted within 10x10 km grid cells. iceberg concentration derived by applying Constant False Alarm Rate (CFAR) algorithm on data from Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) satellite sensors. iceberg product contains two additional datasets of individual iceberg positions in Greenland-Newfoundland-Labrador Waters. datasets in shapefile format best representation icebergs (the 1st dataset contains iceberg point observations, 2nd dataset contains polygonized satellite coverage). also derived by applying Constant False Alarm Rate (CFAR) algorithm on Sentinel-1 SAR imagery.
 Despite precision (individual icebergs proposed), product is generic and automated product needs expertise. For applications marine navigation, refer to national Ice Service of country concerned. DOI (product) :https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00129/moi-00129
---
223
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/high-resolution-vegetation-phenology-and-productivity-ppi
https://www.wekeo.eu/data?view=viewer&t=1562219742857&z=0&center=13.08408%2C48.33915&zoom=12.34&layers=W3siaWQiOiJjMiIsImxheWVySWQiOiJFTzpIUlZQUDpEQVQ6U0VBU09OQUwtVFJBSkVDVE9SSUVTL19fREVGQVVMVF9fL0NMTVNfSFJWUFBfU1RfUFBJXzEwTSIsInpJbmRleCI6NzB9XQ%3D%3D
High Resolution Vegetation Phenology and Productivity: PPI Seasonal Trajectories (raster 10m) version 1 revision 1, Sep. 2021
metadata refers to Plant Phenology Index (PPI) Seasonal Trajectories one products pan-European High Resolution Vegetation Phenology and Productivity (HR-VPP) component of Copernicus Land Monitoring Service (CLMS). Plant Phenology Index (PPI) is physically based vegetation index for improved monitoring plant phenology developed from simplified solution to radiative transfer equation by Jin and Eklundh (2014) has linear relationship with green leaf area index. PPI Seasonal Trajectories (ST) product derived from TIMESAT-based function fitting of time series of PPI vegetation index provides filtered time series of Plant Phenology Index (PPI), with regular 10-day time step. PPI dataset available as raster files with 10 x 10m resolution in UTM/WGS84 projection corresponding to Sentinel-2 tiling grid, for tiles cover EEA38 countries and United Kingdom for period from 2017 until today. updated in first quarter of each year. Each file has associated quality indicator (QFLAG) provides confidence level.
---
224
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/high-resolution-vegetation-phenology-and-productivity-2
https://www.wekeo.eu/data?view=viewer&t=1562219742857&z=0&center=13.08408%2C48.33915&zoom=12.34&layers=W3siaWQiOiJjMSIsImxheWVySWQiOiJFTzpFRUE6REFUOkNMTVNfSFJWUFBfU1QvX19ERUZBVUxUX18vQ0xNU19IUlZQUF9TVF9RRkxBR18xME0iLCJ6SW5kZXgiOjEwfV0%3D
High Resolution Vegetation Phenology and Productivity: Seasonal Trajectories Quality Flag (raster 10m) version 1 revision 1, Sep. 2021
Quality Flag of PPI Seasonal Trajectories is one products of pan-European High Resolution Vegetation Phenology and Productivity (HR-VPP) component of Copernicus Land Monitoring Service (CLMS). Plant Phenology Index (PPI) is physically based vegetation index for improved monitoring of plant phenology developed from simplified solution to radiative transfer equation by Jin and Eklundh (2014) has linear relationship with green leaf area index. PPI Seasonal Trajectories (ST) product derived from TIMESAT-based function fitting of time series of PPI vegetation index provides filtered time series of Plant Phenology Index (PPI), with regular 10-day time step. Quality Flag indicates quality of PPI seasonal trajectory computation, in confidence level. QFLAG dataset available as raster files with 10 x 10m resolution, in UTM/WGS84 projection corresponding to Sentinel-2 tiling grid, for tiles cover EEA38 countries and United Kingdom for period from 2017 until today. updated in first quarter of each year.
---
225
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/black-sea-high-resolution-and-ultra-high-resolution-sea
http://marine.copernicus.eu/services-portfolio/access-to-products/?option=com_csw&view=details&product_id=SST_BS_SST_L4_NRT_OBSERVATIONS_010_006
Black Sea High Resolution and Ultra High Resolution Sea Surface Temperature Analysis
Short description:
 For Black Sea (BS), CNR BS Sea Surface Temperature (SST) processing chain providess daily gap-free (L4) maps at high (HR 0.0625°) ultra-high (UHR 0.01°) spatial resolution over Black Sea. Remotely-sensed L4 SST datasets produced distributed in near-real time by Consiglio Nazionale delle Ricerche - Gruppo di Oceanografia da Satellite (CNR-GOS). SST products based on nighttime images by infrared sensors on satellite platforms cover Southern European Seas. CNR-GOS processing chain includes modules from data extraction preliminary quality control to cloudy pixel removal satellite images collating/merging two-step algorithm allows interpolate SST data at high (HR 0.0625°) ultra-high (UHR 0.01°) spatial resolution applying statistical techniques. L4 data used to estimate SST anomaly pentad climatology. basic design main algorithms described in following papers. DOI (product) :https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00159 https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00159
---
226
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/pan-european-high-resolution-image-mosaic-2012-true-0
https://land.copernicus.eu/imagery-in-situ/european-image-mosaics/high-resolution/Image%202012/core-1-2013-cov-2-5m
Pan-European High Resolution Image Mosaic 2012 - True Colour, Coverage 2 (5 m), June 2015
pan-European High Resolution (HR) Image Mosaic 2012 provides HR1 (High Resolution: 5 meter) coverage over Europe. surface covered by image dataset is 5.8 million square kilometres spatial resolution of 5 meters. imagery composed during specific acquisition windows in 2011, 2012 2013. Coverage 2 acquisitions expected 6 weeks away from Coverage 1 to minimum of 2 weeks for northern countries, including United Kingdom. ± 6 weeks criteria might not be applied over Atlantic Islands French DOMs (seasonal changes limited in equatorial DOMs). Images derived from satellite sensors: RapidEye constellation mosaic used as input data in production of Copernicus Land Monitoring Service (CLMS) datasets and services, land cover maps high resolution layers on land cover characteristic useful for CLMS users for visualizations classifications on land. input imagery for creation mosaic provided by ESA. Due to license restrictions, HR Image Mosaic 2012 only available as web service (WMS), not for data download.

https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/black-sea-ocean-colour-plankton-reflectance-transparency
http://marine.copernicus.eu/services-portfolio/access-to-products/?option=com_csw&view=details&product_id=OCEANCOLOUR_BLK_BGC_L3_NRT_009_151
Black Sea Ocean Colour Plankton, Reflectance, Transparency and Optics L3 NRT daily observations
description Black Sea Ocean Satellite Observations Italian National Research Council (CNR – Rome, Italy), providing Bio-Geo_Chemical (BGC) regional datasets
 ''plankton'' phytoplankton chlorophyll concentration (CHL) evaluated region-specific algorithms (Zibordi et al., 2015; Kajiyama et al., 2018) Phytoplankton Functional Types (PFT) evaluated region-specific algorithm
 ''reflectance'' spectral Remote Sensing Reflectance (RRS)
 ''transparency'' diffuse attenuation coefficient light at 490 nm (KD490)
 ''optics'' IOPs (Inherent Optical Properties) absorption scattering particulate dissolved matter (ADG, APH BBP), via QAAv6 model (Lee et al., 2002 updates) Upstreams SeaWiFS, MODIS, MERIS, VIIRS-SNPP JPSS1, OLCI-S3A & S3B ""multi"" products OLCI-S3A & S3B ""olci"" products Temporal resolution daily Spatial resolutions 1 km for ""multi"" 300 meters for ""olci"" find product catalogue use search keyword ""OCEANCOLOUR_BLK_BGC_L3_NRT"". DOI (product) :https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00301/moi-00301

228
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/multi-observation-global-ocean-sea-surface-salinity-and
http://marine.copernicus.eu/services-portfolio/access-to-products/?option=com_csw&view=details&product_id=MULTIOBS_GLO_PHY_S_SURFACE_MYNRT_015_013
Multi Observation Global Ocean Sea Surface Salinity and Sea Surface Density
description product consits of global gap-free Level-4 (L4) analyses of Sea Surface Salinity (SSS) and Sea Surface Density (SSD) obtained through multivariate optimal interpolation algorithm combines sea surface salinity images from multiple satellite sources NASA’s Soil Moisture Active Passive (SMAP) ESA’s Soil Moisture Ocean Salinity (SMOS) satellites with in situ salinity measurements satellite SST information. product developed by Consiglio Nazionale delle Ricerche (CNR) includes 4 datasets:
 * dataset-sss-ssd-nrt-weekly delivers near-real-time weekly data
 dataset-sss-ssd-nrt-monthly delivers near monthly data
 dataset-sss-ssd-rep-weekly delivers multi-year reprocessed (REP) weekly data
 dataset-sss-ssd-rep-monthly delivers multi-year reprocessed (REP) monthly data Product citation: refer to Technical FAQ for citing products: http://marine.copernicus.eu/faq/cite-cmems-products-cmems-credit/?idpag?idpag... DOI (product) :https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00051-00051

Mediterranean Sea High Resolution and Ultra High Resolution Sea Surface Temperature Analysis
Short description:
 For Mediterranean Sea (MED), CNR MED Sea Surface Temperature (SST) processing chain provides daily gap-free (L4) maps at high (HR 0.0625°) ultra-high (UHR 0.01°) spatial resolution over Mediterranean Sea. Remotely-sensed L4 SST datasets produced distributed in near-real time by Consiglio Nazionale delle Ricerche - Gruppo di Oceanografia da Satellite (CNR-GOS). SST products based on nighttime images by infrared sensors on satellite platforms cover Southern European Seas. CNR-GOS processing chain includes modules data extraction preliminary quality control to cloudy pixel removal satellite images collating/merging two-step algorithm allows interpolate SST data at high (HR 0.0625°) ultra-high (UHR 0.01°) spatial resolution applying statistical techniques. L4 data used to estimate SST anomaly pentad climatology. basic design main algorithms described in following papers. https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/ecde-app-warmest-three-day-period-v1

https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/black-sea-ocean-colour-plankton-reflectance-0
http://marine.copernicus.eu/services-portfolio/access-to-products/?option=com_csw&view=details&product_id=OCEANCOLOUR_BLK_BGC_L3_MY_009_153
Black Sea Ocean Colour Plankton, Reflectance, Transparency and Optics MY L3 daily observations
description Black Sea Ocean Satellite Observations Italian National Research Council (CNR – Rome, Italy), providing multi-years Bio-Geo_Chemical (BGC) regional datasets
 ''plankton'' phytoplankton chlorophyll concentration (CHL) evaluated region-specific algorithms (Zibordi et al., 2015; Kajiyama et al., 2018) Phytoplankton Functional Types (PFT) evaluated region-specific algorithm
 ''reflectance'' spectral Remote Sensing Reflectance (RRS)
 ''transparency'' diffuse attenuation coefficient light at 490 nm (KD490)
 ''optics'' IOPs (Inherent Optical Properties) absorption scattering particulate dissolved matter (ADG, APH BBP), via QAAv6 model (Lee et al., 2002 updates) Upstreams SeaWiFS, MODIS, MERIS, VIIRS-SNPP JPSS1 OLCI-S3A ""multi"" products OLCI-S3A & S3B ""olci"" products Temporal resolution daily Spatial resolution 1 km for ""multi"" 300 meters for ""olci"" find product catalogue use search keyword ""OCEANCOLOUR_BLK_BGC_L3_MY"". DOI (product) :https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00303.48670/moi-00303

 ''transparency'' diffuse attenuation coefficient light at 490 nm (KD490) (for ""multi"" observations region-specific algorithm, Volpe et al., 2019) Upstreams: SeaWiFS, MODIS, MERIS, VIIRS-SNPP JPSS1, OLCI-S3A & S3B for ""multi"" products OLCI-S3A & S3B ""olci"" products Temporal resolutions: monthly daily"gap-free"" data) Spatial resolutions: 1 km for ""multi"" 300 meters for ""olci"" find product catalogue use search keyword ""OCEANCOLOUR_MED_BGC_L4_NRT"". 247
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/water-and-wetness-2015-raster-20-m-europe-3-yearly-nov
https://land.copernicus.eu/pan-european/high-resolution-layers/water-wetness/status-maps/2015/view
Water and Wetness 2015 (raster 20 m), Europe, 3-yearly, Nov. 2020
Copernicus High Resolution Water and Wetness (WAW) 2015 layer is thematic product showing occurrence of water and wet surfaces over period 2009 to 2015 for EEA38 area and United Kingdom metadata corresponds to 20m classified Water and Wetness product. production of High Resolution Water and Wetness layers coordinated by European Environment Agency (EEA) in EU Copernicus programme. Two WAW products available:
 - main Water and Wetness (WAW) product, with defined classes of (1) permanent water, (2) temporary water (3) permanent wetness (4) temporary wetness.
 - additional expert product: Water and Wetness Probability Index (WWPI).
 products show occurrence of water indicate degree of wetness in physical sense assessed independently of actual vegetation cover not limited to specific land cover class relative frequencies. Data provided as mosaic of full area, tiles with side length of 1000 km x 1000 km. In 2020, due to methodological improvements, temporary wet class reprocessed during update for 2018 reference year.
---

https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/grassland-change-2015-2018-raster-20-m-europe-3-yearly
https://land.copernicus.eu/pan-european/high-resolution-layers/grassland/change-maps/grassland-change-2015-2018?tab=download
Grassland Change 2015-2018 (raster 20 m), Europe, 3-yearly, Oct. 2020
High Resolution Layer (HRL) Grassland Change 2015-2018 raster product at 20m resolution provides information on changes in grassland vegetation cover between reference years 2015 and 2018. thematic classes indicate non-grassland areas, grassland gain and loss unchanged grassland both years unverified grassland gain and loss areas for pan-European area of EEA38 and United Kingdom production High grassland layers coordinated by European Environment Agency (EEA) EU Copernicus programme
 dataset provided as 20 meter rasters in 100 x 100 km tiles grouped according to EEA38 countries and United Kingdom conformant with EEA reference grid).
 HRL Grassland layer is main High Resolution grassland product grassy non-woody vegetation baseline product includes all grasslands: managed grassland semi-natural grassland natural grassy vegetation binary status layer for 2015 reference year mapping grassland and all non-grassland areas in 20m and (aggregated) 100m pixel size for 2018 reference year, in 10m (aggregated) 100m pixel size

https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/water-and-wetness-2015-raster-100-m-europe-3-yearly-nov
https://land.copernicus.eu/pan-european/high-resolution-layers/water-wetness/status-maps/2015/view
Water and Wetness 2015 (raster 100 m), Europe, 3-yearly, Nov. 2020
Copernicus High Resolution Water and Wetness (WAW) 2015 layer is thematic product showing occurrence of water and wet surfaces over period 2009 to 2015 for EEA38 area and United Kingdom . metadata corresponds to aggregation of 20m classified product into 100m raster. production of High Resolution Water Wetness layers coordinated by European Environment Agency (EEA) in EU Copernicus programme. Two WAW products available:
 - main Water and Wetness (WAW) product, with defined classes of (1) permanent water (2) temporary water (3) permanent wetness (4) temporary wetness.
 - additional expert product: Water and Wetness Probability Index (WWPI).
 products show occurrence of water indicate degree of wetness in physical sense assessed independently of actual vegetation cover not limited to specific land cover class relative frequencies. Data provided as mosaic of full area, as tiles with side length of 1000 km x 1000 km. In 2020 due to methodological improvements temporary wet class reprocessed during update for 2018 reference year.

251
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/fractional-snow-cover-raster-20m-2016-present-europe
https://cryo.land.copernicus.eu/finder/
Fractional Snow Cover (raster 20m) 2016-present, Europe, daily, Jul. 2020
Copernicus Fractional Snow Cover (FSC) product generated near real-time for EEA38 United Kingdom based on optical satellite data from Sentinel-2 constellation product provides fraction of surface covered by snow at top of canopy (FSC-TOC) and on ground (FSC-OG) per pixel percentage (0% – 100%) with spatial resolution 20 m x 20 m.
 FSC one pan-European High-Resolution Snow & Ice service (HR-S&I), provided at high spatial resolution (20 m x 20 m 60 m x 60 m), from Sentinel-2 and Sentinel-1 constellations data from September 1, 2016 onwards. Visit https://land.copernicus.eu/pan-european/biophysical-parameters/high-res... more information on different HR-S&I products (Snow products : FSC, WDS, SWS, GFSC, PSA. Ice products : RLIE ARLIE)
 FSC product distributed in raster files covering area 110 km by 110 km with pixel size 20 m by 20 m in UTM/WGS84 projection corresponds to Sentinel-2 input L1C product tile. Each product of seven separate files different layers product another metadata file. https://land.copernicus.eu/pan-european/biophysical-parameters/high-res...

Global Ocean Colour (Copernicus-GlobColour), Bio-Geo-Chemical, L4 (monthly and interpolated) from Satellite Observations (Near Real Time)
description: Global Ocean Satellite Observations, ACRI-ST company (Sophia Antipolis, France) providing Bio-Geo-Chemical (BGC) products based Copernicus-GlobColour processor
 Upstreams: SeaWiFS, MODIS, MERIS VIIRS-SNPP & JPSS1 OLCI-S3A & S3B ""multi"" products S3A & S3B ""olci"" products
 Variables: Chlorophyll-a (CHL), Primary Production (PP), Phytoplankton Functional types and sizes (PFT), Suspended Matter (SPM), Particulate Backscattering (BBP), Secchi Transparency Depth (ZSD), Diffuse Attenuation (KD490), Absorption Coef. (ADG440/CDM440) Reflectance (RRS). Temporal resolutions: daily monthly plus some variables daily gap-free space-time interpolation ""cloud free"" product.
 Spatial resolutions: 4 km (global), 1 km (Atlantic ; 46°W-13°E , 20°N-66°N), finer resolution olci 300 meters inputs (Atlantic global coastal).
 Recent products organized in datasets Near Real Time (NRT) long time-series (from 1997) datasets Multi-Years (MY). find Copernicus-GlobColour products catalogue use search keyword ""GlobColour"". DOI (product) :https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00279

https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/global-ocean-colour-copernicus-globcolour-bio-geo
http://marine.copernicus.eu/services-portfolio/access-to-products/?option=com_csw&view=details&product_id=OCEANCOLOUR_GLO_BGC_L3_NRT_009_101
Global Ocean Colour (Copernicus-GlobColour), Bio-Geo-Chemical, L3 (daily) from Satellite Observations (Near Real Time)
description: Global Ocean Satellite Observations, ACRI-ST company (Sophia Antipolis, France) providing Bio-Geo-Chemical (BGC) products based Copernicus-GlobColour processor
 Upstreams: SeaWiFS, MODIS, MERIS VIIRS-SNPP & JPSS1 OLCI-S3A & S3B ""multi"" products S3A & S3B ""olci"" products
 Variables: Chlorophyll-a (CHL), Primary Production (PP), Phytoplankton Functional types and sizes (PFT), Suspended Matter (SPM), Particulate Backscattering (BBP), Secchi Transparency Depth (ZSD), Diffuse Attenuation (KD490), Absorption Coef. (ADG440/CDM440) Reflectance (RRS). Temporal resolutions: daily monthly plus some variables daily gap-free space-time interpolation ""cloud free"" product.
 Spatial resolutions: 4 km (global), 1 km (Atlantic ; 46°W-13°E , 20°N-66°N), finer resolution olci 300 meters inputs (Atlantic global coastal).
 Recent products organized in datasets Near Real Time (NRT) long time-series (from 1997) datasets Multi-Years (MY). find Copernicus-GlobColour products catalogue use search keyword ""GlobColour"". DOI (product) :https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00278
---
260
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/forest-type-2012-raster-100-m-europe-3-yearly-apr-2018
https://land.copernicus.eu/pan-european/high-resolution-layers/forests/forest-type-1/status-maps/2012/view
Forest Type 2012 (raster 100 m), Europe, 3-yearly, Apr. 2018
high resolution forest product consists of three types of (status) products and additional change products status products available for 2012 and 2015 reference years: 1. Tree cover density level tree cover density in range from 0-100%; 2. Dominant leaf type information on dominant leaf type: broadleaved or coniferous; 3. Forest type product. forest type product allows close to FAO forest definition. original (20m) resolution consists of two products: 1) dominant leaf type product MMU of 0.5 ha, 10% tree cover density threshold applied, and 2) support layer maps based dominant leaf type product, trees under agricultural use and urban context (derived from CLC and high resolution imperviousness 2009 data). For final 100m product trees under agricultural use and urban context from support layer are removed high resolution forest change products comprise simple tree cover density change product for 2012-2015 (% increase or decrease of real tree cover density changes).
 production of high resolution forest layers coordinated by European Environment Agency (EEA) in EU Copernicus programme.
---

https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/global-ocean-surface-carbon
http://marine.copernicus.eu/services-portfolio/access-to-products/?option=com_csw&view=details&product_id=MULTIOBS_GLO_BIO_CARBON_SURFACE_REP_015_008
Global Ocean Surface Carbon
description product corresponds to REP L4 time series of monthly global reconstructed surface ocean pCO2 air-sea fluxes of CO2 pH total alkalinity dissolved inorganic carbon saturation state calcite aragonite associated uncertainties on 1° x 1° regular grid. product obtained from ensemble-based forward feed neural network approach mapping situ data for surface ocean fugacity (SOCAT data base, Bakker et al. 2016, https://www.socat.info/) sea surface salinity temperature sea surface height chlorophyll a mixed layer depth atmospheric CO2 mole fraction Sea-air flux fields computed from air-sea gradient of pCO2 dependence on wind speed of Wanninkhof (2014) Surface ocean pH total scale dissolved inorganic carbon saturation states computed from surface ocean pCO2 reconstructed surface ocean alkalinity using CO2sys speciation software. https://www.socat.info/ *Product Citation: refer to Technical FAQ for citing products: http://marine.copernicus.eu/faq/cite-cmems-products-cmems-credit/?idpag?idpag... DOI (product) :https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00047

Tree Cover Density 2012 (raster 20 m), Europe, 3-yearly, Mar. 2018
high resolution forest product consists of three types of (status) products and additional change products status products available for 2012, 2015 2018 reference years: 1. Tree cover density level tree cover density in range from 0-100%; 2. Dominant leaf type information on dominant leaf type: broadleaved or coniferous; 3. Forest type product. forest type product allows to close to FAO forest definition. original (20m) resolution consists of two products: 1) dominant leaf type product MMU of 0.5 ha, 10% tree cover density threshold applied, 2) support layer maps based dominant leaf type product, trees under agricultural use and urban context (derived from CLC and high resolution imperviousness 2009 data). For final 100m product trees under agricultural use and urban context from support layer are removed. high resolution forest change products comprise simple tree cover density change product for 2012-2015 (% increase or decrease of real tree cover density changes).
 production of high resolution forest layers coordinated by European Environment Agency (EEA) in EU Copernicus programme.

271
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/pan-european-high-resolution-image-mosaic-2012-true
https://land.copernicus.eu/imagery-in-situ/european-image-mosaics/high-resolution/Image%202012/COV%202
Pan-European High Resolution Image Mosaic 2012 - True Colour, Coverage 2 (20 m), Febr. 2015
pan-European High Resolution (HR) Image Mosaic 2006 provides HR2 (High Resolution: 20 meter) coverage over Europe for continuation of Corine Land Cover like exercises for generation of HR layers by EU and EEA. surface covered by image dataset is 5.8 million square kilometres spatial resolution of 20 meters. imagery composed during acquisition windows in 2011, 2012 2013. Coverage 2 acquisitions expected 6 weeks away from Coverage 1 to minimum of 2 weeks for northern countries including United Kingdom. ± 6 weeks criteria might not be strictly applied over Atlantic Islands French DOMs (seasonal changes limited in equatorial DOMs). Images derived from satellite sensors: RapidEye constellation mosaic used as input data in production of Copernicus Land Monitoring Service (CLMS) datasets and services, land cover maps high resolution layers on land cover characteristic useful for CLMS users for visualizations classifications on land. input imagery for creation mosaic provided by ESA. Due to license restrictions, HR Image Mosaic 2006 only available as web service (WMS), not for data download.

272
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/black-sea-biogeochemistry-analysis-and-forecast
http://marine.copernicus.eu/services-portfolio/access-to-products/?option=com_csw&view=details&product_id=BLKSEA_ANALYSISFORECAST_BGC_007_010
Black Sea Biogeochemistry Analysis and Forecast
description BLKSEA_ANALYSISFORECAST_BGC_007_010 is nominal product of Black Sea Biogeochemistry NRT system generated by NEMO 4.0-BAMHBI modelling system. Biogeochemical Model for Hypoxic and Benthic Influenced areas (BAMHBI) is innovative biogeochemical model with 28-variable pelagic component carbonate system) 6-variable benthic component represents processes in anoxic layer.
 product provides analysis forecast for 3D concentration of chlorophyll nutrients (nitrate phosphate), dissolved oxygen phytoplankton carbon biomass net primary production pH dissolved inorganic carbon total alkalinity 2D fields of bottom oxygen concentration North-Western shelf), surface partial pressure of CO2 surface flux of CO2. variables computed on grid with ~3km x 59-levels resolution provided as daily and monthly means. Product Citation: refer to Technical FAQ for citing products.http://marine.copernicus.eu/faq/cite-cmems-products-cmems-credit/?idpag... DOI (product) :https://doi.org/10.25423/cmcc/blksea_analysisforecast_bgc_007_010 https://doi.org/10.25423/cmcc/blksea_analysisforecast_bgc_007_010

273
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/black-sea-waves-analysis-and-forecast
http://marine.copernicus.eu/services-portfolio/access-to-products/?option=com_csw&view=details&product_id=BLKSEA_ANALYSISFORECAST_WAV_007_003
Black Sea Waves Analysis and Forecast
Short description:
 wave analysis forecasts for Black Sea produced with third generation spectral wave model WAM Cycle 6. hindcast ten days forecast produced every day on HPC at Helmholtz-Zentrum Hereon. shallow water Black Sea version implemented on spherical grid with spatial resolution 2.5 km (1/40° x 1/40°) with 24 directional 30 frequency bins. active wave model grid points is 74518. model depth refraction wave breaking assimilation of satellite wave wind data system provides hindcast ten days forecast with one-hourly output once a day. atmospheric forcing taken from ECMWF analyses forecast data. WAM forced by surface currents sea surface height from BLKSEA_ANALYSISFORECAST_PHY_007_001. Monthly statistics provided operationally following CMEMS metrics definitions. Product Citation:
 refer to Technical FAQ for citing products. http://marine.copernicus.eu/faq/cite-cmems-products-cmems-credit/?idpag.../faq/cite-cmems-products-credit?idpag... DOI (Product):https://doi.org/10.25423/cmcc/blksea_analysisforecast_wav_007_003_eas5 https://doi.org/10.25423/cmcc/blksea_analysisforecast_wav_007_003_eas5

274
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/european-ground-motion-service-gnss-model-2015-2020
https://land.copernicus.eu/user-corner/technical-library/egms-algorithm-theoretical-basis-document
European Ground Motion Service: GNSS model 2015-2020 (vector), Europe, 2-yearly, Jul. 2022
European Ground Motion Service (EGMS) component of Copernicus Land Monitoring Service. EGMS provides consistent regular standardised harmonised reliable information regarding natural anthropogenic ground motion phenomena over Copernicus Participating States across national borders with millimetre accuracy. metadata describes global navigation satellite system (GNSS) model used to calibrate EGMS Calibrated product (https://sdi.eea.europa.eu/catalogue/srv/eng/catalog.search#/metadata/db...). layer produced based on GNSS data from with EUREF Densification network as main entry point. After filtering quality control 3770 stations used to generate GNSS model contains average velocities in east, north up directions displayed on 50-km grid. grid dimension determined by average distance between well-maintained GNSS stations over continental Europe.
 GNSS model distributed to users in single comma-separated values file. Each cell model associated to value of vertical and horizontal velocity. product covers Copernicus Participating States (except for DROMs) United Kingdom. https://sdi.eea.europa.eu/catalogue/srv/eng/catalog.search#/metadata/db...
---
275
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/european-ground-motion-service-ortho-vertical-component
https://egms.land.copernicus.eu/
European Ground Motion Service: Ortho – Vertical Component 2015-2021 (vector), Europe, yearly, Feb. 2023
European Ground Motion Service (EGMS) is component of Copernicus Land Monitoring Service. EGMS provides consistent, regular standardised harmonised reliable information regarding natural anthropogenic ground motion phenomena over Copernicus Participating States across national borders, with millimetre accuracy. metadata describes third product level of EGMS: Ortho. EGMS Ortho product exploits information by ascending and descending orbits of Calibrated product (https://sdi.eea.europa.eu/catalogue/srv/eng/catalog.search#/metadata/be...) to derive two further layers; one of purely vertical displacements other purely east-west displacements. Both layers resampled to 100 m grid. Ortho product eases interpretation process of non-experts viewing geometry not to considered.
 EGMS Ortho visualised as vector map of measurement points colour-coded by average velocity (vertical or east-west components) distributed to users in comma-separated values format. Each point associated with time series of displacement, plot with values of displacement per acquisition of satellite. https://sdi.eea.europa.eu/catalogue/srv/eng/catalog.search#/metadata/be...
---
276
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/baltic-sea-physics-analysis-and-forecast
http://marine.copernicus.eu/services-portfolio/access-to-products/?option=com_csw&view=details&product_id=BALTICSEA_ANALYSISFORECAST_PHY_003_006
Baltic Sea Physics Analysis and Forecast
Short description:
 Baltic Sea physical model product provides forecasts for physical conditions in Baltic Sea. Baltic forecast updated twice daily new six days forecast. Four datasets provided: One with hourly instantaneous values, one daily mean values one monthly mean values, all containing parameters: sea level variations, ice concentration thickness at surface temperature, salinity horizontal and vertical velocities for 3D field. dataset with 15 minutes (instantaneous) surface values provided for sea level variation surface horizontal currents. product produced by Baltic Sea set up of NEMOv4.0 ocean model. product provided at models native grid with resolution of 1 nautical mile in horizontal, up to 56 vertical depth levels. area covers Baltic Sea including transition area towards North Sea (i Danish Belts, Kattegat Skagerrak). ocean model forced with Stokes drift data from Baltic Wave forecast product (BALTICSEA_ANALYSISFORECAST_WAV_003_010). Satellite SST in-situ T and S profiles assimilated into model's analysis field. DOI (product) :https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00010 https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00010
