277
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/global-ocean-l4-spectral-parameters-nrt-satellite
http://marine.copernicus.eu/services-portfolio/access-to-products/?option=com_csw&view=details&product_id=WAVE_GLO_PHY_SPC_L4_NRT_014_004
GLOBAL OCEAN L4 SPECTRAL PARAMETERS FROM NRT SATELLITE MEASUREMENTS
description: Near-Real-Time multi-mission global satellite-based spectral integral parameters. valid data used based on L3 corresponding product. Included wave parameters are partition significant wave height, partition peak period partition peak or principal direction. parameters propagated in space time at 3-hour timestep regular space grid providing information of swell propagation characteristics from source to land One file gathers one swell system gathering observations from same storm source. product processed by WAVE-TAC multi-mission SAR data processing system to serve near-real time main operational oceanography and climate forecasting centers in Europe worldwide. processes data from SAR missions: Sentinel-1A and Sentinel-1B. spectral parameter measurements optimally interpolated using swell observations same swell field. SAR data processing system produces wave integral parameters by partition (partition significant wave height, partition peak period partition peak or principal direction) associated standard deviation density of propagated observations. DOI (product) :https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00175
---
278
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/pan-european-high-resolution-image-mosaic-2018-false
https://land.copernicus.eu/imagery-in-situ/european-image-mosaics/high-resolution/high-resolution-image-mosaics-2018/high-resolution-image-mosaic-2018-false-colour-10m
Pan-European High Resolution Image Mosaic 2018 - False Colour, Coverage 1 (10 m), Sept. 2019
pan-European High Resolution (HR) Image Mosaic 2018 provides cloud-free high resolution false colour imagery for EEA39 countries. mosaic produced using Sentinel-2 data in 10 meter resolution at Sentinel 2 tile level consists of 1079 Sentinel-2 tiles. imagery for each state acquired within predefined window to vegetation season in 2018. false colour composite consists of three band stack includes bands:
 Band 8 – NIR (0.842 μm)
 Band 4 – Red (0.665 μm)
 Band 3 – Green (0.560 μm) mosaic used as input data in production of Copernicus Land Monitoring Service (CLMS) datasets and services land cover maps high resolution layers on land cover characteristic useful for CLMS users for visualizations classifications on land. pan-European High Resolution Mosaic 2018 created exclusively from Sentinel-2 data imagery can be downloaded from Copernicus Open Access Hub (mission since 2015) at https://scihub.copernicus.eu/. Global Sentinel-2 Image Mosaics Hub at https://land.copernicus.eu/imagery-situ/global-mosaics can used to automatically create mosaics over area of interest. https://scihub.copernicus.eu

279
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/baltic-sea-biogeochemistry-analysis-and-forecast
http://marine.copernicus.eu/services-portfolio/access-to-products/?option=com_csw&view=details&product_id=BALTICSEA_ANALYSISFORECAST_BGC_003_007
Baltic Sea Biogeochemistry Analysis and Forecast
description Baltic Sea biogeochemical model product provides forecasts for biogeochemical conditions in Baltic Sea. Baltic forecast updated daily new six days forecast. Three datasets provided One with daily one monthly means values for parameters: nitrate, phosphate, chl-a, ammonium, dissolved oxygen, ph, phytoplankton zooplankton, silicate dissolved inorganic carbon partial pressure of co2 at surface. Instantaenous hourly values for Secchi Depth light attenuation valid for noon (12Z) included in daily mean files/dataset. third dataset with daily accumulated values netto primary production available. product produced by biogeochemical model ERGOM (Neumann, 2000) one way coupled to Baltic Sea set up of NEMO ocean model provides CMEMS Baltic physical ocean forecast product (BALTICSEA_ANALYSISFORECAST_PHY_003_006). biogeochemical product provided at models native grid with resolution of 1 nautical mile horizontal up to 56 vertical depth levels. product covers Baltic Sea including transition area towards North Sea (i Danish Belts, Kattegat Skagerrak). DOI (product) :https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00009 https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00009

280
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/mediterranean-sea-ocean-colour-plankton-reflectance
http://marine.copernicus.eu/services-portfolio/access-to-products/?option=com_csw&view=details&product_id=OCEANCOLOUR_MED_BGC_L3_NRT_009_141
Mediterranean Sea Ocean Colour Plankton, Reflectance, Transparency and Optics L3 NRT daily observations
description Mediterranean Sea Ocean Satellite Observations Italian National Research Council (CNR – Rome, Italy), providing Bio-Geo_Chemical (BGC) regional datasets
 ''plankton'' phytoplankton chlorophyll concentration (CHL) evaluated region-specific algorithms (Case 1 waters Volpe et al., 2019 new coefficients Case 2 waters Berthon and Zibordi, 2004) Phytoplankton Functional Types (PFT) evaluated region-specific algorithm (Di Cicco et al. 2017)
 ''reflectance'' spectral Remote Sensing Reflectance (RRS)
 ''transparency'' diffuse attenuation coefficient light at 490 nm (KD490) ""multi"" observations region-specific algorithm Volpe et al., 2019)
 ''optics'' IOPs (Inherent Optical Properties) absorption scattering particulate dissolved matter (ADG, APH, BBP), via QAAv6 model (Lee et al., 2002 updates) Upstreams SeaWiFS, MODIS, MERIS, VIIRS-SNPP JPSS1, OLCI-S3A & S3B ""multi"" products OLCI-S3A & S3B ""olci"" products Temporal resolution: daily Spatial resolutions 1 km for ""multi"" 300 meters for ""olci"" find product catalogue use search keyword ""OCEANCOLOUR_MED_BGC_L3_NRT"". DOI (product) :https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00297

281
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/pan-european-high-resolution-image-mosaic-2018-true
https://land.copernicus.eu/imagery-in-situ/european-image-mosaics/high-resolution/high-resolution-image-mosaics-2018/high-resolution-image-mosaic-2018-true-colour-10m
Pan-European High Resolution Image Mosaic 2018 - True Colour, Coverage 1 (10 m), Sept. 2019
pan-European High Resolution (HR) Image Mosaic 2018 provides cloud-free high resolution true colour imagery for EEA39 countries. mosaic produced using Sentinel-2 data in 10 meter resolution at Sentinel 2 tile level consists of 1079 Sentinel-2 tiles. imagery for each state acquired within predefined window corresponding to vegetation season in 2018. true colour (RGB) composite consists three band stack includes bands:
 Band 4 – Red (0.665 μm)
 Band 3 – Green (0.560 μm)
 Band 2 – Blue (0.490 μm) mosaic used as input data in production of Copernicus Land Monitoring Service (CLMS) datasets and services, land cover maps high resolution layers on land cover characteristic useful for CLMS users for visualizations classifications on land. pan-European High Resolution Mosaic 2018 created exclusively from Sentinel-2 data imagery can be downloaded from Copernicus Open Access Hub (mission since 2015) at https://scihub.copernicus.eu/. Global Sentinel-2 Image Mosaics Hub at https://land.copernicus.eu/imagery/global-mosaics can used to automatically create mosaics over area of interest. https://scihub.copernicus.eu

http://marine.copernicus.eu/services-portfolio/access-to-products/?option=com_csw&view=details&product_id=OCEANCOLOUR_MED_BGC_L3_MY_009_143
Mediterranean Sea Ocean Colour Plankton, Reflectance, Transparency and Optics MY L3 daily observations
description Mediterranean Sea Ocean Satellite Observations Italian National Research Council (CNR – Rome, Italy), providing multi-years Bio-Geo_Chemical (BGC) regional datasets
 ''plankton'' phytoplankton chlorophyll concentration (CHL) evaluated region-specific algorithms (Case 1 waters Volpe et al., 2019 new coefficients Case 2 waters Berthon and Zibordi, 2004) Phytoplankton Functional Types (PFT) evaluated region-specific algorithm (Di Cicco et al. 2017)
 ''reflectance'' spectral Remote Sensing Reflectance (RRS)
 ''transparency'' diffuse attenuation coefficient light at 490 nm (KD490) ""multi"" observations region-specific algorithm Volpe et al., 2019)
 ''optics'' IOPs (Inherent Optical Properties) absorption scattering particulate dissolved matter (ADG, APH BBP), via QAAv6 model (Lee et al., 2002 updates) Upstreams SeaWiFS, MODIS, MERIS, VIIRS-SNPP JPSS1, OLCI-S3A ""multi"" products OLCI-S3A & S3B ""olci"" products Temporal resolution: daily Spatial resolution 1 km for ""multi"" 300 meters for ""olci"" find product catalogue use search keyword ""OCEANCOLOUR_MED_BGC_L3_MY"". https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/global-ocean-l3-significant-wave-height-reprocessed
http://marine.copernicus.eu/services-portfolio/access-to-products/?option=com_csw&view=details&product_id=WAVE_GLO_PHY_SWH_L3_MY_014_005
GLOBAL OCEAN L3 SIGNIFICANT WAVE HEIGHT FROM REPROCESSED SATELLITE MEASUREMENTS
description: Multi-Year mono-mission satellite-based along-track significant wave height. valid data included based on rigorous editing combining criteria quality flags (surface flag, presence of ice) thresholds on parameter values thresholds applied on parameters linked to significant wave height determination from retracking (e.g. SWH, sigma0, range off nadir angle...). missions homogenized with reference mission in-situ buoy measurements. along-track filter applied to reduce measurement noise. product based on ESA Sea State Climate Change Initiative data Level 3 product (version 2) formatted by WAVE-TAC homogeneous with CMEMS Level 3 Near-real-time product. based on reprocessing of GDR data from altimeter missions: Jason-1, Jason-2, Envisat, Cryosat-2, SARAL/AltiKa Jason-3. CFOSAT Multi-Year dataset based on reprocessing of CFOSAT Level-2P products (CNES/CLS), inter-calibrated on Jason-3 reference mission issued from CCI Sea State dataset. One file containing valid SWH produced for each mission for 3-hour time window. contains filtered SWH (VAVH) and unfiltered SWH (VAVH_UNFILTERED). DOI (product) :https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00176.48670/moi-00176

284
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/european-ground-motion-service-ortho-east-west-component
https://egms.land.copernicus.eu/
European Ground Motion Service: Ortho – East-West Component 2015-2021 (vector), Europe, yearly, Feb. 2023
European Ground Motion Service (EGMS) is component of Copernicus Land Monitoring Service. EGMS provides consistent regular standardised harmonised reliable information regarding natural anthropogenic ground motion phenomena over Copernicus Participating States across national borders, with millimetre accuracy. metadata describes third product level of EGMS: Ortho. EGMS Ortho product exploits information by ascending and descending orbits of Calibrated product (https://sdi.eea.europa.eu/catalogue/srv/eng/catalog.search#/metadata/be...) to derive two further layers; one of purely vertical displacements, other purely east-west displacements Both layers resampled to 100 m grid. Ortho product eases interpretation process of non-experts viewing geometry not considered.
 EGMS Ortho visualised as vector map of measurement points colour-coded by average velocity (vertical or east-west components) distributed to users in comma-separated values format. Each point associated with time series of displacement, plot with values of displacement per acquisition of satellite. product covers Copernicus Participating States and United Kingdom. https://sdi.eea.europa.eu/catalogue/srv/eng/catalog.search#/metadata/be...
---
285
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/sis-agroproductivity-indicators
https://cds.climate.copernicus.eu/cdsapp#!/dataset/sis-agroproductivity-indicators
sis-agroproductivity-indicators
dataset provides crop productivity indicators near real-time evapotranspiration indicators ending 2018 with high-resolution coverage of agricultural regions with dominant cropping patterns around globe. crop productivity indicators provide insight into phenological development (periodic events in biological life cycles), total biomass yield (crop weight per unit area land) of four major crops (wheat, maize soybean rice) at high grid resolution (0.1° x 0.1°) global coverage. high resolution global coverage allow indicators analyse effect of climate variability on crop yields at regional scales. crop productivity indicators not suitable for field-scale analysis. evapotranspiration indicators provide actual potential vegetation soil evapotranspiration. sum of water vapor fluxes from soil evaporation wet canopy evaporation plant transpiration at dry canopy surface. product provides insight into regional interannual variability in vegetation water use (actual potential) water stress can be used as indicator to determine impact of water stress on crops vegetation. evapotranspiration indicators not suitable for field-scale analysis. dataset produced on behalf of Copernicus Climate Change Service.
---
286
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/global-ocean-thermosteric-sea-level-anomaly-0-700m-time
http://marine.copernicus.eu/services-portfolio/access-to-products/?option=com_csw&view=details&product_id=GLOBAL_OMI_SL_thsl_area_averaged_anomalies_0_700
Global Ocean Thermosteric Sea Level anomaly (0-700m) time series and trend from Reanalysis & Multi-Observations Reprocessing
DEFINITION temporal evolution of thermosteric sea level in ocean layer obtained from integration of temperature driven ocean density variations subtracted from reference climatology to obtain fluctuations from average field regional thermosteric sea level values averaged from 60°S-60°N monitor interannual to long term global sea level variations caused by temperature driven ocean volume changes through thermal expansion expressed in meters (m). CONTEXT global mean sea level changes in Earth’s climate system to natural anthropogenic factors ocean warming land ice mass loss changes in water storage in continental river basins. Thermosteric sea-level variations result from temperature related density changes in sea water with volume expansion and contraction. Global thermosteric sea level rise caused by ocean warming major drivers of contemporary global mean sea level rise (Cazenave et al., 2018; Oppenheimer et al., 2019). KEY FINDINGS Since 2005 upper (0-700m) near-global (60°S-60°N) thermosteric sea level rises rate of 0.9±0.1 mm/year. key findings updated annually in November line with OMI evolutions. DOI (product):https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00239-00239
---

Global Ocean Thermosteric Sea Level anomaly (0-2000m) time series and trend from Reanalysis & Multi-Observations Reprocessing
DEFINITION temporal evolution of thermosteric sea level in ocean layer obtained from integration of temperature driven ocean density variations subtracted from reference climatology to obtain fluctuations from average field regional thermosteric sea level values averaged from 60°S-60°N monitor interannual to long term global sea level variations caused by temperature driven ocean volume changes through thermal expansion expressed in meters (m). CONTEXT global mean sea level changes in Earth’s climate system to natural anthropogenic factors ocean warming land ice mass loss changes in water storage in continental river basins. Thermosteric sea-level variations result from temperature related density changes in sea water with volume expansion and contraction. Global thermosteric sea level rise caused by ocean warming major drivers of contemporary global mean sea level rise (Cazenave et al., 2018; Oppenheimer et al., 2019). KEY FINDINGS Since 2005 upper (0-2000m) near-global (60°S-60°N) thermosteric sea level rises at rate of 1.3±0.2 mm/year. key findings updated annually in November line with OMI evolutions. DOI (product):https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00240

288
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/pan-european-very-high-resolution-image-mosaic-2018-true
https://land.copernicus.eu/imagery-in-situ/european-image-mosaics/very-high-resolution/very-high-resolution-image-mosaic-2018-true-colour-2m
Pan-European Very High Resolution Image Mosaic 2018 - True Colour (2 m), Oct. 2021
pan-European Very High Resolution (VHR) Image Mosaic 2018 is seamless mosaic of VHR 2018 dataset, based on watershed segmentation of image overlaps. input data mix of Pleiades, SPOT, DOVE, Kompsat-4, Deimos-2, SuperView, TripleSat images. input imagery colour balanced against Sentinel-2 based HR mosaic from 2018. Colour balancing is done through iterative histogram matching, first iteration to identify clouds and snow second iteration re-balances with bright objects masked out. Cloud cover minimized through innovative approach to cloud masking, on automatically identifying and de-prioritizing overly bright areas in mosaic. Some clouds and snow remain, as all pixels have to have a value, if no cloud or snow free images available for area, bright pixels will remain. mosaic used as input data in production of Copernicus Land Monitoring Service (CLMS) datasets and services, land cover maps high resolution layers on land cover characteristic useful for CLMS users for visualizations and classifications on land. input imagery for creation mosaic provided by ESA. Due to license restrictions, VHR Image Mosaic 2018 only available as a web service (WMS), not for data download.
---
289
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/european-ground-motion-service-calibrated-2015-2021
https://egms.land.copernicus.eu/
European Ground Motion Service: Calibrated 2015-2021 (vector), Europe, yearly, Feb. 2023
European Ground Motion Service (EGMS) is component of Copernicus Land Monitoring Service. EGMS provides consistent, regular standardised harmonised reliable information regarding natural and anthropogenic ground motion phenomena over Copernicus Participating States across national borders, with millimetre accuracy. metadata describes second product level of EGMS: Calibrated. This product considered main EGMS product serves needs of most users. contains same information as Basic product (https://sdi.eea.europa.eu/catalogue/srv/eng/catalog.search#/metadata/1a...), but measurement points referenced to model from global navigation satellite system data. measurements not relative considered as absolute. calibrated product makes possible to compare ground motion measurements from adjacent areas to different products of same level. https://sdi.eea.europa.eu/catalogue/srv/eng/catalog.search#/metadata/1a... EGMS Calibrated is visualised as vector map of measurement points, colour-coded by average velocity distributed to users in comma-separated values format. Each point associated with time series of displacement, plot with values of displacement per acquisition of satellite. product generated for both ascending and descending orbits.

https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/high-resolution-snow-and-ice-monitoring-persistent-snow-0
https://cryo.land.copernicus.eu/finder/
High Resolution Snow and Ice Monitoring: Persistent Snow Area (raster 20m)
Copernicus Persistent Snow Area (PSA) product generated annually for EEA38 United Kingdom based on Fractional Snow Cover (FSC) information provides extent of persistent snow cover area where snow present throughout hydrological year with spatial resolution of 20 m x 20 m. metadata refers to PSA product distributed in raster files as tiles aligned with Sentinel-2 (UTM/WGS84) at 20 m x 20 m GSD. also available another projection as tiles aligned with Pan-European High-Resolution Layers in European 20 m x 20 m grid (ETRS89 LAEA - EPSG: 3035) typically released annual release date in October after end of hydrological year. Each product of two separate files corresponding to different layers product another metadata file. PSA one of products of pan-European High-Resolution Snow & Ice service (HR-S&I), provided at high spatial resolution (20 m x 20 m and 60 m x 60 m), from Sentinel-2 and Sentinel-1 constellations data from September 1, 2016 onwards. Visit https://land.copernicus.eu/pan-european/biophysical-parameters/high-res... more information on different HR-S&I products (Snow products: FSC, WDS, SWS, GFSC, PSA. Ice products: RLIE and ARLIE) https://land.copernicus.eu-res...

292
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/global-ocean-l3-spectral-parameters-reprocessed-satellite
http://marine.copernicus.eu/services-portfolio/access-to-products/?option=com_csw&view=details&product_id=WAVE_GLO_PHY_SPC_L3_MY_014_006
GLOBAL OCEAN L3 SPECTRAL PARAMETERS FROM REPROCESSED SATELLITE MEASUREMENTS
description: Multi-Year mono-mission satellite-based integral parameters derived from directional wave spectra. Using linear propagation wave model, only wave observations back-propagated to wave converging regions considered. dataset parameters includes partition significant wave height, partition peak period principal direction along swell propagation path in space and time at 3-hour timestep from source to land. Validity flags included for each parameter indicates valid time steps along propagation (eg. no propagation for significant wave height close to storm source or any integral parameter when reaching land). integral parameters at observation point available with quality flag based on consistency between each propagated observation and overall swell field.This product processed by WAVE-TAC multi-mission SAR data processing system processes data from SAR missions: Sentinel-1A and Sentinel-1B.One file produced for each mission available in two formats: one gathering in all observations related to same swell field, another all observations in 3-hour time range for both formats propagated information from source to land. DOI (product) :https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00174.48670/moi-00174

Atlantic-Iberian Biscay Irish- Ocean Biogeochemical Analysis and Forecast
Short description:
 IBI-MFC provides high-resolution biogeochemical analysis forecast product covering European waters specifically Iberia–Biscay–Ireland (IBI) area. last 2 years now (historic best estimates) daily averaged forecasts with horizon of 10 days (updated weekly basis) available on catalogue.
 online coupled physical-biogeochemical operational system based on NEMO-PISCES at 1/36° adapted to IBI area Mercator-Ocean charge of model code development. PISCES model of intermediate complexity with 24 prognostic variables simulates marine biological productivity of lower trophic levels describes biogeochemical cycles of carbon main nutrients (P, N, Si, Fe).
 product provides daily monthly averages of main biogeochemical variables: chlorophyll, oxygen, nitrate, phosphate, silicate, iron, ammonium, net primary production euphotic zone depth, phytoplankton carbon, pH, dissolved inorganic carbon surface partial pressure of carbon dioxide zooplankton. 294
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/atlantic-meridional-overturning-circulation-amoc-profile
http://marine.copernicus.eu/services-portfolio/access-to-products/?option=com_csw&view=details&product_id=GLOBAL_OMI_NATLANTIC_amoc_26N_profile
Atlantic Meridional Overturning Circulation AMOC profile at 26N from Reanalysis
DEFINITION Atlantic Meridional Overturning profile at 26.5N obtained by integrating meridional transport at 26.5 N across Atlantic basin (zonally) doing cumulative integral in depth. climatological mean taken over time done over whole time period (1993-2016) and period for comparable observations (Apr 2004-Mar 2016). observations from RAPID array (Smeed et al, 2017). CONTEXT Atlantic Meridional Overturning Circulation (AMOC) transports heat northwards in Atlantic key role in regional and global climate (Srokosz et al, 2012). northwards transport in upper kilometer from northwards flow in Gulf Stream and wind-driven Ekman transport southwards flow in ocean interior deep western boundary currents (Srokosz et al, 2012). uncertainties in deep profile associated with transport returned in upper (1-3km) or lower (3-5km) North Atlantic deep waters (Roberts et al 2013, Sinha et al 2018). CMEMS KEY FINDINGS AMOC strength at 1000m 17.1 ± 4.7 Sv (1 Sverdrup=106m3/s; range is 2 x standard deviation of multi-product). See Jackson et al (2018). Note key findings updated annually in November in line with OMI evolutions. DOI (product):https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00231.48670/moi-00231

description
 operational TOPAZ5-ECOSMO Arctic Ocean system uses ECOSMO biological model coupled online to TOPAZ5 physical model for future update of ARCTIC_ANALYSIS_FORECAST_PHYS_002_001_a physical forecast run daily 10 days forecast of 3D biogeochemical variables ocean. coupling by FABM framework Coupling to biological ocean model provides description of evolution of basic biogeochemical variables. output of daily mean fields standard grid 40 fixed levels in NetCDF4 CF format. Surface Chlorophyll-a from satellite ocean colour assimilated every week projected downwards using Uitz et al. (2006) method new 10-day forecast produced daily using previous day's forecast up-to-date prognostic forcing fields.
 Output products have 6.25 km resolution at North Pole (equivalent to 1/8 deg) on stereographic projection. See Product User Manual for exact projection parameters. DOI (product) :https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00003

Atlantic -Iberian Biscay Irish- Ocean Wave Reanalysis
Short description:
 IBI-MFC provides high-resolution wave reanalysis product for Iberia-Biscay-Ireland (IBI) area starting 01/01/1993 regularly extended yearly basis. model system run by Nologin with support of CESGA supercomputing resources.
 MY model set-up analogous to model set in IBI-MFC Near-Real-Time (NRT) analysis and forecast system model application based on MFWAM model developed by Meteo-France (MF), with same grid of 5 km of horizontal resolution. Both MY and NRT products fed by ECMWF hourly winds MY system forced by ERA5 reanalysis wind data. boundary conditions NRT system uses 2D wave spectra from Copernicus Marine GLOBAL forecast system MY system nested to GLOBAL reanalysis.
 product offers hourly instantaneous fields of different wave parameters, including Wave Height, Period and Direction for total spectrum fields of Wind Wave (or wind sea), Primary Swell Wave and Secondary Swell for partitioned wave spectra. Product Citation:

 * GLORYS2V4 from Mercator Ocean (Fr);
 * ORAS5 from ECMWF;

 product provides daily, monthly yearly averages of main biogeochemical variables: chlorophyll, oxygen, nitrate, phosphate, silicate, iron, ammonium net primary production, euphotic zone depth phytoplankton carbon, pH dissolved inorganic carbon surface partial pressure of carbon dioxide. climatological parameters (monthly mean and standard deviation) of these variables for period 1993-2016 are delivered. Black Sea - High Resolution Diurnal Subskin Sea Surface Temperature Analysis
description: Black Sea - CNR diurnal sub-skin Sea Surface Temperature product provides daily gap-free (L4) maps of hourly mean sub-skin SST at 1/16° (0.0625°) horizontal resolution over CMEMS Black Sea (BS) domain combining infrared satellite and model data (Marullo et al., 2014). implementation product takes advantage of consolidated operational SST processing chains provide daily mean SST fields over same basin (Buongiorno Nardelli et al., 2013). sub-skin temperature is temperature at base of thermal skin layer equivalent to foundation SST at night daytime significantly different under favorable (clear sky low wind) diurnal warming conditions. sub-skin SST L4 product created combining geostationary satellite observations from SEVIRI and model data first-guess) from CMEMS BS Monitoring Forecasting Center (MFC). approach takes advantage geostationary satellite observations input signal produce hourly gap-free SST fields using model analyses as first-guess. resulting SST anomaly field (satellite-model) free, or nearly free, of diurnal cycle interpolate SST anomalies using satellite data at different times day (Marullo et al, 2014). 300
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/high-resolution-snow-and-ice-monitoring-aggregated-river
https://land.copernicus.eu/user-corner/technical-library/hrsi-ice-pum
High Resolution Snow and Ice Monitoring: Aggregated River and Lake Ice Extent
Copernicus Aggregated River and Lake Ice Extent (ARLIE) product is spatially aggregated information on surface water conditions of rivers lakes. ARLIE information stored in geodatabase enriched from River and Lake Ice extent products (RLIE S1, RLIE S2 RLIE S1+S2) for entire EEA38 United Kingdom. provides percent coverage of snow-covered or snow-free ice on lakes 10 km river sections described by EU-HYDRO river and lake network database. ARLIE products stored in PostGIS persistent geodatabase retrieved specific REST API. Users query ice sheet summary information of river segments lakes (ARLIE statistics) geometry caracteristics of features statistics estimated. geometry features delivered in ETRS89 LAEA (EPSG:3035) coordinate reference system. ARLIE is one products pan-European High-Resolution Snow & Ice service (HR-S&I), provided at high spatial resolution (20 m x 20 m and 60 m x 60 m) from Sentinel-2 and Sentinel-1 constellations data from September 1, 2016 onwards. Visit https://land.copernicus.eu/pan-european/biophysical-parameters/high-res... more information on HR-S&I products (Snow products : FSC, WDS SWS GFSC, PSA. Ice products : RLIE ARLIE) https://land.copernicus.eu/pan-european/biophysical-parameters/high-res...

https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/coastal-zones-land-coverland-use-2018-vector-europe-6
https://land.copernicus.eu/local/coastal-zones/coastal-zones-2018?tab=download
Coastal Zones Land Cover/Land Use 2018 (vector), Europe, 6-yearly, Feb. 2021
Coastal Zones (CZ) LC/LU product for 2018 detailed Land Cover / Land Use (LC/ LU) dataset for areas coastline of EEA38 countries United Kingdom reference year 2018 for classification product monitors landscape dynamics in European coastal territory to inland depth 10 km total area approximately 730,000 km2 all relevant areas (estuaries, coastal lowlands nature reserves). production of coastal zone layers coordinated by European Environment Agency (EEA) EU Copernicus programme Copernicus Land Monitoring Service (CLMS) Local Component. Coastal Zones product covers buffer zone of coastline derived from EU-Hydro v1.1. Land Cover/Land Use (LC/LU) layer extracted from Very High Resolution (VHR) satellite data other available data. class definitions follow pre-defined nomenclature Mapping and Assessment of Ecosystems and their Services (MAES) typology of ecosystems (Level 1 to Level 4) and CORINE Land Cover adapted to specific characteristics of coastal zones. classification provides 71 distinct thematic classes with Minimum Mapping Unit (MMU) of 0.5 ha Minimum Mapping Width (MMW) of 10 m. product available for 2012 and 2018 reference year including change mapping. CZ dataset distributed in vector format in single OGC GeoPackage SQLite file covering area of interest.

303
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/high-resolution-snow-and-ice-monitoring-wetdry-snow
https://cryo.land.copernicus.eu/finder/
High Resolution Snow and Ice Monitoring: Wet/Dry Snow (raster 60m)
Copernicus Wet/Dry Snow (WDS) product generated near real-time for EEA38 United Kingdom based on radar satellite data from Sentinel-1 constellation product differentiates snow state conditions within snow mask defined by FSCTOC information (snow fraction at top of canopy - see Copernicus Fractional Snow Cover product) with spatial resolution 60 m x 60 m provides binary discrimination of wet and dry snow identifying patchy snow or snow free areas. WDS product distributed in raster files covering area 110 km by 110 km with pixel size 60 m by 60 m in UTM/WGS84 projection corresponds to Sentinel-2 input L1C product tile. Each product composed of two separate GeoTIFF files to different layers product snow state classification -SSC- quality layer -QCSSC-) metadata file. WDS one of products pan-European High-Resolution Snow & Ice service (HR-S&I), provided at high spatial resolution (20 m x 20 m and 60 m x 60 m), from Sentinel-2 and Sentinel-1 constellations data from September 1, 2016 onwards. Visit https://land.copernicus.eu/pan-european/biophysical-parameters/high-res... more information on different HR-S&I products (Snow products : FSC, WDS SWS GFSC, PSA. Ice products : RLIE ARLIE). https://land.copernicus.eu/pan-european/biophysical-parameters/high-res...

304
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/high-resolution-vegetation-phenology-and-productivity-4
https://www.wekeo.eu/data?view=viewer&t=1566840390697&z=0&center=13.08408%2C48.33915&zoom=12.34&%3D&initial=1
High Resolution Vegetation Phenology and Productivity: Plant Phenology Index (raster 10m) version 1 revision 1, Sep. 2021
metadata refers to Plant Phenology Index (PPI) dataset, near real-time (NRT) Vegetation Index products of pan-European High Resolution Vegetation Phenology and Productivity (HR-VPP), component of Copernicus Land Monitoring Service (CLMS). Plant Phenology Index (PPI) is physically based vegetation index for improved monitoring plant phenology developed from simplified solution radiative transfer equation by Jin and Eklundh (2014) PPI has linear relationship with green leaf area index strong correlation with gross primary productivity disentangling remotely sensed plant phenology from snow seasonality superior to other indices for spring phenology retrieval over northern latitudes GPP estimation in African semi-arid ecosystems. Comparison of satellite-derived PPI to ground observations plant phenology gross primary productivity (GPP) shows similarity of temporal patterns over Nordic boreal forest sites. PPI dataset available as raster files with 10 x 10m resolution in UTM/WGS84 projection to Sentinel-2 tiling grid for tiles cover EEA38 countries and United Kingdom for period from October 2016 until today with daily updates. Each file has associated quality indicator (QFLAG2) to assist screening of clouds, shadows from clouds topography, snow water surfaces.

306
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/tree-cover-density-mask-2012-2015-raster-20-m-europe-3
https://land.copernicus.eu/pan-european/high-resolution-layers/forests/tree-cover-density/change-maps/tree-cover-change-mask-2012-2015?tab=download
Tree Cover Density Mask 2012-2015 (raster 20 m), Europe, 3-yearly, Dec. 2020
Copernicus High Resolution Forest Layer Tree Cover Change Mask (TCCM) 2012-2015 raster product provides information on change between reference years 2012 and 2015 consists of 4 thematic classes (unchanged areas with no tree cover / new tree cover / loss of tree cover / unchanged areas with tree cover) at 20m spatial resolution covers EEA38 area United Kingdom. production of High Resolution Forest layers coordinated by European Environment Agency (EEA) in EU Copernicus programme. High Resolution Forest product consists of three types of (status) products and additional change products. status products available for 2012, 2015 2018 reference years: 1. Tree cover density level tree cover density in from 0-100%; 2. Dominant leaf type information on leaf type: broadleaved or coniferous; 3. Forest type product. forest type product allows close to FAO forest definition. In original (20m) resolution consists of two products: 1) dominant leaf type product MMU of 0.5 ha, 10% tree cover density threshold applied, 2) support layer maps dominant leaf, trees under agricultural use and in urban context (derived from CLC and high resolution imperviousness 2009 data). For final 100m product trees under agricultural use and urban context from support layer are removed.

308
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/atlantic-iberian-biscay-irish-ocean-wave-analysis-and
http://marine.copernicus.eu/services-portfolio/access-to-products/?option=com_csw&view=details&product_id=IBI_ANALYSIS_FORECAST_WAV_005_005
Atlantic-Iberian Biscay Irish- Ocean Wave Analysis and Forecast
Short description:
 IBI-MFC provides high-resolution wave analysis forecast product (run twice a day by Nologin with support of CESGA supercomputing resources), covering European waters specifically Iberia–Biscay–Ireland (IBI) area. last 2 years now (historic best estimates) hourly instantaneous forecasts horizon of up to 10 days (updated daily) available on catalogue.
 IBI wave model system based on MFWAM model runs on grid of 5 km of horizontal resolution forced with ECMWF hourly wind data. system assimilates significant wave height (SWH) altimeter data CFOSAT wave spectral data (supplied by Météo-France), forced by currents provided by IBI ocean circulation system.
 product offers hourly instantaneous fields of different wave parameters, including Wave Height, Period Direction for total spectrum fields of Wind Wave (or wind sea), Primary Swell Wave Secondary Swell for partitioned wave spectra. IBI wave system set up to provide internally key parameters used forcing in IBI NEMO ocean model forecast run. Product Citation:
 refer to Technical FAQ for citing products.[http://marine.copernicus.eu/faq/cite-cmems-products-cmems-credit/?idpag...] http://marine.copernicus/faq/cite-cmems-products-cmems-credit/?idpag... DOI (Product):https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00025.48670/moi-00025

309
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/imperviousness-change-2015-2018-raster-20-m-europe-3
https://land.copernicus.eu/pan-european/high-resolution-layers/imperviousness/change-maps/2015-2018/imperviousness-change-2015-2018
Imperviousness Change 2015-2018 (raster 20 m), Europe, 3-yearly, Aug. 2020
High Resolution Layer Imperviousness Change (IMC) 2015-2018 is 20m raster dataset showing change in imperviousness between 2015 and 2018 years produced in EU Copernicus programme. high resolution imperviousness products capture percentage change of soil sealing. Built-up areas characterized by substitution of original natural land cover surface with artificial often impervious cover artificial surfaces maintained over long periods time. series of high resolution imperviousness datasets (for 2006, 2009, 2012, 2015 2018 years) with artificially sealed areas produced using automatic derivation based on calibrated Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI). series imperviousness layers main status layers. are per-pixel estimates of impermeable cover soil (soil sealing) mapped as degree of imperviousness (0-100%). Imperviousness change layers produced as difference between reference years (2006-2009, 2009-2012 2012-2015 2015-2018 2006-2012 to match CORINE Land Cover production cycle) presented 1) as degree of imperviousness change (-100% -- +100%), in 20m and 100m pixel size, 2) classified (categorical) 20m change product. dataset provided as 20 meter rasters conformant with EEA reference grid) in 100 x 100 km tiles grouped according to EEA38 countries and United Kingdom.

https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/atlantic-iberian-biscay-irish-ocean-physics-reanalysis
http://marine.copernicus.eu/services-portfolio/access-to-products/?option=com_csw&view=details&product_id=IBI_MULTIYEAR_PHY_005_002
Atlantic-Iberian Biscay Irish- Ocean Physics Reanalysis
Short description:
 IBI-MFC provides ocean physical reanalysis product for Iberia-Biscay-Ireland (IBI) area starting 01/01/1993 regularly updated yearly basis. model system run by Mercator-Ocean product post-processed to user’s format by Nologin with support of CESGA supercomputing resources.
 IBI model numerical core based on NEMO v3.6 ocean general circulation model run at 1/12° horizontal resolution. Altimeter data, in situ temperature salinity vertical profiles satellite sea surface temperature assimilated.
 product offers 3D daily monthly yearly ocean fields hourly mean fields for surface variables. Daily monthly yearly averages of 3D Temperature, 3D Salinity, 3D Zonal and Meridional Velocity components Mix Layer Depth Sea Bottom Temperature Sea Surface Height provided. hourly means of surface fields for variables Sea Surface Height Mix Layer Depth Surface Temperature Currents Barotropic Velocities distributed. climatological parameters (monthly mean standard deviation) of variables for period 1993-2016 delivered. Product Citation:
 refer to Technical FAQ for citing products.[http://marine.copernicus.eu/faq/cite-cmems-products-cmems-credit/?idpag...] http://marine.copernicus/faq/cite-cmems-products-cmems-credit/?idpag... DOI (Product):https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00028.48670/moi-00028

Mediterranean Sea Waves Analysis and Forecast
description MEDSEA_ANALYSISFORECAST_WAV_006_017 is nominal wave product of Mediterranean Sea Forecasting system composed by hourly wave parameters at 1/24o horizontal resolution covering Mediterranean Sea extending up to 18.125W into Atlantic Ocean. waves forecast component (Med-WAV system) is wave model based on WAM Cycle 6. Med-WAV modelling system resolves prognostic part wave spectrum with 24 directional and 32 logarithmically distributed frequency bins model solutions corrected by optimal interpolation data assimilation scheme of track satellite significant wave height observations. atmospheric forcing provided by operational ECMWF Numerical Weather Prediction model wave model forced with hourly averaged surface currents and sea level from MEDSEA_ANALYSISFORECAST_PHY_006_013 at 1/24° resolution. model uses wave spectra for Open Boundary Conditions from GLOBAL_ANALYSIS_FORECAST_WAV_001_027 product. wave system includes 2 forecast cycles twice per day Mediterranean wave analysis and 10 days of wave forecasts. 314
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/high-resolution-vegetation-phenology-and-productivity-vpp
https://www.wekeo.eu/data?view=viewer&t=1577751120000&z=0&center=13.08408%2C48.33915&zoom=12.34&layers=W3siaWQiOiJjMCIsImxheWVySWQiOiJFTzpFRUE6REFUOkNMTVNfSFJWUFBfVlBQL19fREVGQVVMVF9fL0NMTVNfSFJWUFBfVlBQX1FGTEFHX1NFQVNPTjFfMTBNIiwiekluZGV4IjoxMH1d&initial=1
High Resolution Vegetation Phenology and Productivity: VPP quality flag (raster 10m) version 1 revision 1, Sept. 2021
Quality Flag (QFLAG), one of Vegetation Phenology and Productivity (VPP) parameters, product of pan-European High Resolution Vegetation Phenology and Productivity (HR-VPP) component of Copernicus Land Monitoring Service (CLMS). Plant Phenology Index (PPI) is physically based vegetation index developed for improving monitoring vegetation growth cycle. PPI index values, with 5-day satellite revisit cycle first used in function fitting to derive PPI Seasonal Trajectories filtered time series with regular 10-day time step. From these Seasonal Trajectories, suite of 13 Vegetation Phenology and Productivity (VPP) parameters computed and provided for up to two seasons each year. Seasonal Productivity is one of 13 parameters. full list available in table 3 of Product User Manual https://land.copernicus.eu/user-corner/technical-library/product-user Quality Flag (QFLAG) is quality indicator for set of 13 Vegetation Phenology and Productivity (VPP) parameters and provides confidence level described in table 4 of same manual. QFLAG dataset available as raster files with 10 x 10m resolution, in UTM/WGS84 projection corresponding to Sentinel-2 tiling grid, for tiles cover EEA38 countries and United Kingdom for two seasons in each year from 2017 onwards. updated in first quarter of each year.

https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/global-ocean-biogeochemistry-hindcast
http://marine.copernicus.eu/services-portfolio/access-to-products/?option=com_csw&view=details&product_id=GLOBAL_MULTIYEAR_BGC_001_029
Global Ocean Biogeochemistry Hindcast
description biogeochemical hindcast for global ocean produced at Mercator-Ocean (Toulouse. France). provides 3D biogeochemical fields for 1993-2019 at 1/4 degree 75 vertical levels uses PISCES biogeochemical model (available on NEMO[https://www.nemo-ocean.eu/] modelling platform). No data assimilation product. https://www.nemo-ocean.eu/ Latest NEMO version (v3.6_STABLE)
 Forcings: GLORYS2V4-FREE.mercator-ocean.eu/solutions ocean physics produced at Mercator-Ocean ERA-Interim.ecmwf.int/forecasts/datasets/reanalysis...] atmosphere produced at ECMWF daily frequency
 Outputs: Daily (chlorophyll. nitrate. phosphate. silicate dissolved oxygen. primary production) monthly (chlorophyll nitrate phosphate silicate dissolved oxygen primary production iron phytoplankton carbon) 3D mean fields interpolated on standard regular grid in NetCDF format simulation performed once and for all.
 Initial conditions: World Ocean Atlas 2013 for nitrate. phosphate silicate dissolved oxygen. GLODAPv2 for DIC and Alkalinity. climatological model outputs for Iron and DOC
 Quality/Accuracy/Calibration information See related Quality Information Document https://www.mercator-ocean.eu/solutions-expertises https://www.ecmwf.int/en/forecasts/datasets/archive-datasets/reanalysis... DOI (product):https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00019

316
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/global-ocean-l3-spectral-parameters-nrt-satellite
http://marine.copernicus.eu/services-portfolio/access-to-products/?option=com_csw&view=details&product_id=WAVE_GLO_WAV_L3_SPC_NRT_OBSERVATIONS_014_002
GLOBAL OCEAN L3 SPECTRAL PARAMETERS FROM NRT SATELLITE MEASUREMENTS
description: Near-Real-Time mono-mission satellite-based integral parameters derived from directional wave spectra. Using linear propagation wave model only wave observations back-propagated to wave converging regions considered. dataset parameters includes partition significant wave height, partition peak period principal direction along swell propagation path in space and time at 3-hour timestep from source to land. Validity flags included for each parameter valid time steps along propagation (eg. no propagation for significant wave height close to storm source or integral parameter when reaching land). integral parameters at observation point available with quality flag based on consistency between each propagated observation and overall swell field.This product processed by WAVE-TAC multi-mission SAR data processing system serves near-real time main operational oceanography and climate forecasting centers in Europe and worldwide. processes near-real-time data from SAR missions: Sentinel-1A and Sentinel-1B.One file produced for each mission available in two formats: one gathering in all observations related to same swell field, and another all observations in 3-hour time range for both propagated information from source to land. DOI (product) :https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00178 https://doi.48670/moi-00178

317
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/lake-water-quality-2016-2018-raster-1-km-global-10-daily
https://land.copernicus.eu/global/products/
Lake Water Quality 2016-2018 (raster 1 km), global, 10-daily - version 1
Monitoring water quality in lakes reservoirs is key in maintaining safe water for drinking bathing fishing agriculture aquaculture activities. Long-term trends and short-term changes are indicators of environmental health changes in water catchment area. Directives EU's Water Framework Directive or US EPA Clean Water Act request information about ecological status of all lakes larger than 50 ha. Satellite monitoring helps to cover large number of lakes reservoirs, reducing needs for monitoring infrastructure (e.g. vessels) and efforts. Lake Water Quality products provide semi-continuous observation record for large number of medium and large-sized lakes, according to Global Lakes and Wetlands Database (GLWD) or of specific environmental monitoring interest. They consist of three water quality parameters: (i) turbidity of lake describes water clarity sunlight penetrate deeper parts lake. Turbidity varies seasonally, with discharge of rivers growth of phytoplankton; (ii) trophic state index indicator of productivity of lake in of phytoplankton, indirectly reflects eutrophication status of water body (iii) lake surface reflectances describe apparent colour of water body intended for scientific users interested in further development of algorithms. visual reflectance bands can be combined into true-colour images.
---

Monitoring water quality in lakes reservoirs is key in maintaining safe water for drinking bathing fishing agriculture aquaculture activities. Long-term trends and short-term changes are indicators of environmental health changes in water catchment area. Directives EU's Water Framework Directive or US EPA Clean Water Act request information about ecological status of all lakes larger than 50 ha. Satellite monitoring helps to cover large number of lakes reservoirs, reducing needs for monitoring infrastructure (e.g. vessels) and efforts. Lake Water Quality products provide semi-continuous observation record for large number of medium and large-sized lakes, according to Global Lakes and Wetlands Database (GLWD) or of specific environmental monitoring interest. They consist of three water quality parameters: (i) turbidity of lake describes water clarity sunlight penetrate deeper parts lake. Turbidity varies seasonally, with discharge of rivers growth of phytoplankton; (ii) trophic state index indicator of productivity of lake in of phytoplankton, indirectly reflects eutrophication status of water body (iii) lake surface reflectances describe apparent colour of water body intended for scientific users interested in further development of algorithms. visual reflectance bands can be combined into true-colour images.
---
321
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/lake-water-quality-2002-2012-raster-1-km-global-10-daily
https://land.copernicus.eu/global/products/
Lake Water Quality 2002-2012 (raster 1 km), global, 10-daily - version 1
Monitoring water quality in lakes reservoirs is key in maintaining safe water for drinking bathing fishing agriculture aquaculture activities. Long-term trends and short-term changes are indicators of environmental health changes in water catchment area. Directives EU's Water Framework Directive or US EPA Clean Water Act request information about ecological status of all lakes larger than 50 ha. Satellite monitoring helps to cover large number of lakes reservoirs, reducing needs for monitoring infrastructure (e.g. vessels) and efforts. Lake Water Quality products provide semi-continuous observation record for large number of medium and large-sized lakes, according to Global Lakes and Wetlands Database (GLWD) or of specific environmental monitoring interest. They consist of three water quality parameters: (i) turbidity of lake describes water clarity sunlight penetrate deeper parts lake. Turbidity varies seasonally, with discharge of rivers growth of phytoplankton; (ii) trophic state index indicator of productivity of lake in of phytoplankton, indirectly reflects eutrophication status of water body (iii) lake surface reflectances describe apparent colour of water body intended for scientific users interested in further development of algorithms. visual reflectance bands can be combined into true-colour images.

https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/season-minimum-value-2017-present-raster-10-m-europe
https://www.wekeo.eu/data?view=viewer&t=1577905116279&z=0&center=13.08408%2C48.33915&zoom=12.34&layers=W3siaWQiOiJjMCIsImxheWVySWQiOiJFTzpIUlZQUDpEQVQ6VkVHRVRBVElPTi1QSEVOT0xPR1ktQU5ELVBST0RVQ1RJVklUWS1QQVJBTUVURVJTL19fREVGQVVMVF9fL0NMTVNfSFJWUFBfVlBQX01JTlZfU0VBU09OMV8xME0iLCJ6SW5kZXgiOjgwfV0%3D&initial=1
Season Minimum Value 2017-present (raster 10 m), Europe, yearly, Sept. 2021
Minimum Value (MINV), one of Vegetation Phenology and Productivity (VPP) parameters, is product of pan-European High Resolution Vegetation Phenology and Productivity (HR-VPP) component of Copernicus Land Monitoring Service (CLMS). Minimum Value (MINV) is average Plant Phenology Index (PPI) value of minima before growing season. Plant Phenology Index (PPI) is physically based vegetation index developed for improving monitoring vegetation growth cycle. PPI index values, with 5-day satellite revisit cycle, used in function fitting to derive PPI Seasonal Trajectories, filtered time series with regular 10-day time step. From these Seasonal Trajectories, suite of 13 Vegetation Phenology and Productivity (VPP) parameters computed and provided for up to two seasons each year. Minimum Value is one of 13 parameters. full list available in table 3 of Product User Manual https://land.copernicus.eu/user-corner/technical-library/product-user complementary quality indicator (QFLAG) provides confidence level described in table 4 of same manual. MINV dataset available as raster files with 10 x 10m resolution, in UTM/WGS84 projection corresponding to Sentinel-2 tiling grid, for tiles cover EEA38 countries and United Kingdom for two seasons in each year from 2017 onwards. updated in first quarter of each year.

High Resolution Snow and Ice Monitoring: River and Lake Ice Extent (raster 20m)
Copernicus River and Lake Ice Extent (RLIE) products provide pixel-based information about ice presence on rivers lakes. several RLIE products available for EEA38 United Kingdom depending on data source. RLIE S1 and RLIE S2 generated in near real-time on observations from Sentinel-1 and Sentinel-2 constellations RLIE S1+S2 delayed-time product derived from previous products - RLIE S2 for given day enriched with RLIE S1 same day. All RLIE products distributed in raster files covering area 110 km by 110 km with pixel size 60 m by 60 m in UTM/WGS84 projection, corresponds to Sentinel-2 L1C product tile. inform of presence of snow-covered or snow-free ice on water bodies described by EU-HYDRO river and lake network database. Each product composed of three separate files to different layers product, another metadata file. RLIE products part of products pan-European High-Resolution Snow & Ice service (HR-S&I), provided at high spatial resolution (20 m x 20 m and 60 m x 60 m), from Sentinel-2 and Sentinel-1 constellations data from September 1, 2016 onwards.
 Visit https://land.copernicus.eu/pan-european/biophysical-parameters/high-res... more information on different HR-S&I products (Snow products : FSC, WDS, SWS, GFSC, PSA. Ice products : RLIE and ARLIE). https://land-res...

https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/imperviousness-classified-change-2015-2018-raster-20-m
https://land.copernicus.eu/pan-european/high-resolution-layers/imperviousness/change-maps/2015-2018/imperviousness-classified-change-2015-2018
Imperviousness Classified Change 2015-2018 (raster 20 m), Europe, 3-yearly, Aug. 2020
High Resolution Layer: Imperviousness Change Classified (IMCC) 2015-2018 is 20m raster dataset showing classified change in imperviousness between 2015 and 2018 years. dataset produced in EU Copernicus programme. high resolution imperviousness products capture percentage change of soil sealing. Built-up areas characterized by substitution of original natural land cover with artificial often impervious cover artificial surfaces maintained over long periods time. series of high resolution imperviousness datasets (for 2006, 2009, 2012, 2015 2018 years) with artificially sealed areas produced using automatic derivation based on calibrated Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI). series imperviousness layers main status layers. are per-pixel estimates of impermeable cover of soil (soil sealing) mapped as degree of imperviousness (0-100%). Imperviousness change layers produced as difference between reference years (2006-2009, 2009-2012 2012-2015 2015-2018 2006-2012 to match CORINE Land Cover production cycle) presented 1) as degree of imperviousness change (-100% -- +100%), in 20m and 100m pixel size, and 2) classified (categorical) 20m change product. dataset provided as 20 meter rasters conformant with EEA reference grid) in 100 x 100 km tiles grouped according to EEA38 countries and United Kingdom.

325
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/european-ground-motion-service-basic-2015-2021-vector
https://land.copernicus.eu/user-corner/technical-library/egms-product-user-manual
European Ground Motion Service: Basic 2015-2021 (vector), Europe, yearly, Feb. 2023
European Ground Motion Service (EGMS) component of Copernicus Land Monitoring Service. EGMS provides consistent regular standardised harmonised reliable information regarding natural anthropogenic ground motion phenomena over Copernicus Participating States across national borders with millimetre accuracy. metadata describes first product level of EGMS: Basic. EGMS Basic - provides InSAR displacement data in satellite Line-of-Sight (LOS), with annotated geo-localisation quality measures per measurement point product generated from interferometric analysis of Sentinel-1 radar images at full resolution. contains line of sight velocity maps in ascending and descending orbits with annotated geolocalisation quality parameters per measurement point. Basic product referred to local reference point; ground motion measurements meaningful only within small subset of full product. not possible to compare deformation from adjacent areas different processing units same level. EGMS Basic visualised as vector map of measurement points colour-coded by average line-of-sight velocity distributed to users in comma-separated values format. Each point associated with time series of displacement, plot with values of displacement per acquisition of satellite. product generated for both ascending and descending orbits.
 processing of dataset in period from August 2022 to January 2023.

Season Amplitude 2017-present (raster 10 m), Europe, yearly, Sept. 2021
Season Amplitude (AMPL), one of Vegetation Phenology and Productivity (VPP) parameters, is product of pan-European High Resolution Vegetation Phenology and Productivity (HR-VPP) component of Copernicus Land Monitoring Service (CLMS). Season Amplitude (AMPL) is difference between maximum and minimum Plant Phenology Index (PPI) values reached during season. Plant Phenology Index (PPI) is physically based vegetation index developed for improving monitoring vegetation growth cycle. PPI index values, with 5-day satellite revisit cycle used in function fitting to derive PPI Seasonal Trajectories filtered time series with regular 10-day time step. Amplitude is one of 13 parameters. full list available in table 3 of Product User Manual https://land.copernicus.eu/user-corner/technical-library/product-user complementary quality indicator (QFLAG) provides confidence level described in table 4 of same manual. AMPL dataset available as raster files with 10 x 10m resolution, in UTM/WGS84 projection corresponding to Sentinel-2 tiling grid, for tiles cover EEA38 countries and United Kingdom for two seasons in each year from 2017 onwards. updated in first quarter of each year.

328
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/riparian-zones-land-coverland-use-2018-vector-europe-6
https://land.copernicus.eu/local/riparian-zones/riparian-zones-2018
Riparian Zones Land Cover/Land Use 2018 (vector), Europe, 6-yearly, Dec. 2021
Riparian zones represent transitional areas between land freshwater ecosystems characterised by distinctive hydrology, soil biotic conditions influenced by stream water. They provide of riparian functions (e chemical filtration flood control bank stabilization aquatic life riparian wildlife support ecosystem services. Riparian Zones products support objectives of European legal acts policy initiatives EU Biodiversity Strategy to 2020 Habitats and Birds Directives Water Framework Directive. metadata refers to Riparian Zones 2018 Land Cover/Land Use (LC/LU), LC/LU classification tailored to needs biodiversity monitoring in variable buffer zone of selected rivers (Strahler levels 2-9 from EU-Hydro) for reference year 2018. LC/LU extracted from Very High Resolution (VHR) satellite data other available data in buffer zone of selected rivers for supporting biodiversity monitoring mapping and assessment of ecosystems their services. class definitions follow pre-defined nomenclature on Mapping and Assessment of Ecosystems and their Services (MAES) typology of ecosystems (Level 1 to Level 4) and CORINE Land Cover. classification provides 55 distinct thematic classes with Minimum Mapping Unit (MMU) of 0.5 ha Minimum Mapping Width (MMW) of 10 m. production of Riparian Zones products coordinated by European Environment Agency in EU Copernicus programme.

https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/mediterranean-sea-biogeochemistry-analysis-and-forecast
http://marine.copernicus.eu/services-portfolio/access-to-products/?option=com_csw&view=details&product_id=MEDSEA_ANALYSISFORECAST_BGC_006_014
Mediterranean Sea Biogeochemistry Analysis and Forecast
Description
 biogeochemical analysis forecasts for Mediterranean Sea at 1/24° horizontal resolution (ca. 4 km) produced MedBFM4 model system MedBFM4 run by OGS (IT), consists coupling multi-stream atmosphere radiative model OASIM multi-stream in-water radiative tracer transport model OGSTM_BIOPTIMOD v4.3 biogeochemical flux model BFM v5. MedBFM4 features 3D variational data assimilation scheme 3DVAR-BIO v3.3 with assimilation of surface chlorophyll (CMEMS-OCTAC NRT product) vertical profiles of chlorophyll, nitrate oxygen (BGC-Argo floats by CORIOLIS DAC).
 biogeochemical MedBFM system forced by NEMO-OceanVar model (MEDSEA_ANALYSIS_FORECAST_PHY_006_013 product run by CMCC), produces one day hindcast ten days forecast (every day) seven days analysis (weekly Tuesday). Salon, S., Cossarini, G. Bolzon, G. Feudale, L. Lazzari, P. Teruzzi, A. Solidoro, C. Crise, A., 2019. Marine Ecosystem forecasts: performance of CMEMS Mediterranean Sea model system. Ocean Sci. Discuss. 1–35. https://doi.org/10.5194/os-2018-145.5194 ''Product Citation'' refer to Technical FAQ for citing products. http://marine.copernicus.eu/faq/cite-cmems-products-cmems-credit/?idpag...-cmems-products-credit?idpag... https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/global-ocean-ensemble-physics-reanalysis-low-resolution
http://marine.copernicus.eu/services-portfolio/access-to-products/?option=com_csw&view=details&product_id=GLOBAL_REANALYSIS_PHY_001_026
Global Ocean Ensemble Physics Reanalysis - Low resolution
Short description:
 new Mercator Ocean (Toulouse, FR) Global Ocean Ensemble Reanalysis: monthly means of Temperature, Salinity Currents Ice variables at 1 degree horizontal resolution for 75 vertical levels starting from 1993 onward. Global ocean reanalyses are homogeneous 3D descriptions of physical state ocean spanning several decades produced with numerical ocean model constrained with data assimilation of satellite and in situ observations. multi-model ensemble approach allows uncertainties or error bars in ocean state estimated ensemble mean may provide for certain regions periods more reliable estimate than individual reanalysis product. four reanalyses used ensemble covering “altimetric era” period (starting from 1st of January 1993) altimeter altimetry data observations available:
 GLORYS2V4 from Mercator Ocean (Fr) ;
 ORAS5 from ECMWF ;
 GloSea5 from Met Office (UK) ;
 C-GLORS05 from CMCC (It).
 provided as four different time series of global ocean simulations 3D monthly estimates post-processed to create Global Reanalysis Ensemble Product (GREP). Available variables are temperature, salinity velocities ice variables. reanalyses built to be close to observations realistic) in agreement with model physics. numerical products available are monthly mean averages describing ocean from surface to bottom (5900 m). DOI (product) :https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00023

337
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/mediterranean-sea-high-resolution-diurnal-subskin-sea
http://marine.copernicus.eu/services-portfolio/access-to-products/?option=com_csw&view=details&product_id=SST_MED_PHY_SUBSKIN_L4_NRT_010_036
Mediterranean Sea - High Resolution Diurnal Subskin Sea Surface Temperature Analysis
description Mediterranean Sea - CNR diurnal sub-skin Sea Surface Temperature (SST) product provides daily gap-free (L4) maps of hourly mean sub-skin SST at 1/16° (0.0625°) horizontal resolution over CMEMS Mediterranean Sea (MED) domain combining infrared satellite model data (Marullo et al., 2014). implementation product takes advantage consolidated operational SST processing chains provide daily mean SST fields over same basin (Buongiorno Nardelli et al, 2013). sub-skin temperature is temperature at base of thermal skin layer equivalent to foundation SST at night daytime significantly different under favorable (clear sky low wind) diurnal warming conditions. sub-skin SST L4 product created combining geostationary satellite observations from SEVIRI and model data first-guess) from CMEMS MED Monitoring Forecasting Center (MFC). approach takes advantage geostationary satellite observations input signal source produce hourly gap-free SST fields using model analyses as first-guess. resulting SST anomaly field (satellite-model) free, or nearly free of diurnal cycle interpolate SST anomalies using satellite data at different times day (Marullo et al., 2014). [https://help.marine.copernicus.eu/en/articles/4444611-how-to-cite-or-re... https://help.marine.copernicus.eu/en/articles/4444611-how-cite-re... DOI (product) :https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00170 https://doi.48670/moi-00170

338
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/satellite-earth-radiation-budget
https://cds.climate.copernicus.eu/cdsapp#!/dataset/satellite-earth-radiation-budget
satellite-earth-radiation-budget
Earth’s Radiation Budget (ERB) represents balance between incoming and outgoing radiant energy at Earth’s Top-of-the-Atmosphere. This Essential Climate Variable (ECV) is primary forcing of climate system a fundamental quantity to be monitored to understand Earth’s climate and variability. ERB comprises quantification of incoming radiation from Sun and outgoing reflected shortwave and emitted longwave radiation. ERB represents balance between incoming, predominantly solar, radiation and outgoing radiation as reflected solar radiation or thermal radiation emitted by Earth system. Earth is in of dynamic radiative balance, energy arriving from Sun balanced by outgoing radiation from top-of-the-atmosphere. Changes in Earth’s surface and atmosphere (including cloud amount properties, concentrations of greenhouse gases) alter radiative balance Earth system change balance and distribution of outgoing thermal radiation and reflected solar radiation. Aside from elevation (height) of sun above horizon, largest factor controlling variability in Earth radiation budget is cloud cover; fraction of cloud cover, height and opacity impact on reflected solar and outgoing infrared radiation. knowledge of cloud properties, with atmospheric composition and surface properties allows earth radiation budget to be computed. This catalogue entry comprises data from sources summarised in following sections.
---
339
https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/share-built-2018-raster-100-m-europe-3-yearly-aug-2020
https://land.copernicus.eu/pan-european/high-resolution-layers/imperviousness/status-maps/impervious-built-up-2018
Share of Built-up 2018 (raster 100 m), Europe, 3-yearly, Aug. 2020
text provides detailed description of Share of Built-up (SBU) layer for year 2018 including context, production method format breakdown:
 What is SBU layer?

 data layer representing percentage of built-up (impervious) areas within 100m x 100m grid cells for EEA38 countries and UK
 key indicator of soil sealing conversion of natural or semi-natural land to artificial, impervious surfaces.

 How produced?

 derived from high-resolution imperviousness layers produced by EEA under EU Copernicus program
 high-resolution layers capture percentage change of soil sealing over time
 generated using combination of
 Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI) data: index measures difference between near-infrared and red light reflectance sensitive to vegetation density.
 Automatic derivation: refers to algorithms models to process NDVI data generate imperviousness maps.



 Data availability

 SBU layer for 2018 part of series of imperviousness datasets for different reference years (2006, 2009, 2012, 2015, 2018).
 Imperviousness change layers also available showing changes in soil sealing between these years
 data provided as
 100m aggregate raster (a gridded map) covering entire EEA38 and UK area.



 Key terms:

 Soil sealing: process of covering natural or semi-natural land with impervious surfaces concrete asphalt buildings.
 Imperviousness: degree surface prevents water from infiltrating soil.
 NDVI (Normalized Difference Vegetation Index): used index to assess vegetation cover.
 EEA (European Environment Agency): body provides information and data on environmental issues in Europe.
 Copernicus: Earth observation program by European Union.

 Applications:

Monitoring assessing urban sprawl land-use change.
 Understanding impacts soil sealing on water resources biodiversity climate change.
 Planning for sustainable urban development mitigating negative effects urbanization.

High Resolution Snow and Ice Monitoring: SAR Wet Snow (raster 60m)
great description of Copernicus SAR Wet Snow (SWS) product! breakdown of key information how used:


 Purpose SWS product provides information about presence or absence of wet snow in high mountain areas
 Data Source: uses data from Sentinel-1 constellation radar satellites
 Spatial Resolution product has resolution 60 meters by 60 meters
 Coverage: covers entire EEA38 (European Economic Area) United Kingdom
 Frequency: product generated in near real-time.

 Key Features:

 Binary Information: SWS product provides binary information classifies each pixel as containing wet snow or not
 Product Components product consists of
 WSM layer: Shows extent of wet snow from Sentinel-1 data.
 QCWSM layer: Provides quality information for each pixel with detected snow.


 Distribution product distributed as GeoTIFF files.
 Projection product uses UTM/WGS84 projection.

 Applications:

 Hydrological Modeling: Wet snow information crucial for hydrological models influences snowmelt runoff.
 Avalanche Forecasting: Wet snow increase risk of avalanches information important for safety
 Climate Monitoring: Tracking wet snow extent monitor climate change effects on mountain environments

 Further Information

 HR-S&I Service SWS part of pan-European High-Resolution Snow & Ice (HR-S&I) service provides various snow and ice-related products
 Website For more details SWS product other HR-S&I products visit Copernicus website: https://land.copernicus.eu/pan-european/biophysical-parameters/high-resolution-snow-ice

 Overall Copernicus SAR Wet Snow (SWS) product provides valuable information for understanding snow conditions in high mountain areasinformation critical for various applications related to hydrology, safety climate monitoring.

https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/slope-green-period-2017-present-raster-10-m-europe-yearly
https://www.wekeo.eu/data?view=viewer&t=1577905116279&z=0&center=13.08408%2C48.33915&zoom=12.34&layers=W3siaWQiOiJjMCIsImxheWVySWQiOiJFTzpIUlZQUDpEQVQ6VkVHRVRBVElPTi1QSEVOT0xPR1ktQU5ELVBST0RVQ1RJVklUWS1QQVJBTUVURVJTL19fREVGQVVMVF9fL0NMTVNfSFJWUFBfVlBQX0xTTE9QRV9TRUFTT04xXzEwTSIsInpJbmRleCI6ODB9XQ%3D%3D&initial=1
Slope of the Green-up Period 2017-present (raster 10 m), Europe, yearly, Sept. 2021
detailed informative explanation of LSLOPE dataset, key component of Copernicus Land Monitoring Service (CLMS). breakdown of information provided:
 What is LSLOPE?

 LSLOPE (Left Slope) is measure of rate vegetation greening starts in spring.
 Vegetation Phenology and Productivity (VPP) parameter, one of 13 derived from Plant Phenology Index (PPI).

 How is LSLOPE calculated?

 PPI Data: PPI physically based vegetation index calculated using satellite data with 5-day revisit cycle.
 Seasonal Trajectories: PPI data fitted to function generate smoothed time series Seasonal Trajectory with 10-day time step.
 LSLOPE Calculation: LSLOPE calculated from Seasonal Trajectory as slope of vegetation greening phase at start of growing season.

 Important Details:

 Resolution: LSLOPE provided as raster files with 10m x 10m resolution.
 Geographic Coverage: data covers EEA38 countries and UK.
 Temporal Coverage: Data available for two seasons (spring and autumn) per year starting from 2017 onwards.
 Update Frequency: data updated in first quarter of each year.
 Quality Indicator (QFLAG): quality indicator (QFLAG) provides confidence level for LSLOPE data described in detail in Product User Manual.

 Significance of LSLOPE:
 LSLOPE dataset important because:

 Monitoring Vegetation Dynamics: provides insights into timing rate of vegetation greening crucial for understanding impacts of climate change, land use changes other factors on vegetation growth.
 Early Warning Systems: dataset used to develop early warning systems for potential changes in vegetation productivity, drought or disease outbreaks.
 Ecological Studies: provides valuable information for ecological studies monitoring distribution of plant species assessing health of ecosystems.

Where to Find More Information:

 Product User Manual provides comprehensive description of LSLOPE dataset associated parameters.
 Copernicus Land Monitoring Service (CLMS) website offers additional resources access to data.

 information highlights importance of LSLOPE dataset role in providing crucial insights into vegetation dynamics health of ecosystems.
---

https://www.copernicus.eu/en/access-data/copernicus-services-catalogue/total-productivity-2017-present-raster-10-m-europe-yearly
https://www.wekeo.eu/data?view=viewer&t=1577905116279&z=0&center=13.08408%2C48.33915&zoom=12.34&layers=W3siaWQiOiJjMCIsImxheWVySWQiOiJFTzpIUlZQUDpEQVQ6VkVHRVRBVElPTi1QSEVOT0xPR1ktQU5ELVBST0RVQ1RJVklUWS1QQVJBTUVURVJTL19fREVGQVVMVF9fL0NMTVNfSFJWUFBfVlBQX1RQUk9EX1NFQVNPTjFfMTBNIiwiekluZGV4Ijo4MH1d&initial=1
Total Productivity 2017-present (raster 10 m), Europe, yearly, Sept. 2021
great explanation of Total Productivity (TPROD) dataset within Copernicus Land Monitoring Service (CLMS). breakdown of key information and clarifications:
 Key Points:

 What is TPROD? TPROD is measure of total plant growth (or productivity) during growing season calculated by summing up daily values of vegetation index (PPI) across entire season.
 How calculated?
 Plant Phenology Index (PPI) is measure of plant health and activity, derived from satellite data.
 PPI values collected every 5 days.
 These values smoothed fitted into "Seasonal Trajectory" regular 10-day time series.
 TPROD calculated by summing all PPI values in Seasonal Trajectory between start of growing season (SOSD) and end (EOSD).


 What data like?
 TPROD provided as raster files with 10 x 10 meter resolution.
 data projected in UTM/WGS84, aligned with Sentinel-2 satellite data.
 covers EEA38 countries and United Kingdom.
 Data available for two growing seasons per year starting from 2017.


 How often is updated? TPROD dataset updated in first quarter of each year.
 Quality Assessment: quality indicator (QFLAG) provided to assess confidence level of TPROD data.

 Clarifications:

 Season Start (SOSD) and End (EOSD): These dates mark beginning and end of plant's growing season determined using PPI data not fixed dates.
 PPI: index designed to monitor plant growth cycles sensitive to different factors like temperature, rainfall, plant species.
 Copernicus Land Monitoring Service (CLMS): European initiative uses satellite data to monitor Earth's land surface.

 summary
 TPROD dataset provides valuable information about plant productivity across Europe.'s useful tool for understanding health of vegetation monitoring agricultural production assessing impacts of climate change on ecosystems.
---

Imperviousness Density 2018 (raster 10 m), Europe, 3-yearly, Aug. 2020
summary of High Resolution Layer on Imperviousness Density 2018 dataset breakdown of key information
 What?

 Theme: Soil sealing density land covered by impervious surfaces like buildings roads parking lots).
 Coverage: EEA-38 countries (European Economic Area) United Kingdom
 Time Period: 2018 data from 2017-2019).
 Resolution: High resolution (10-meter pixels).

 Key Features

 Data Type: Raster datasets (100 x 100 km tiles).
 Measurement: Percentage of imperviousness (0-100%).
 Production Method: Automated derivation using Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI).
 Data Availability series of datasets for multiple years (2006, 2009, 2012, 2015, 2018).
 Change Analysis: Imperviousness change layers available showing difference in sealing density between reference years

 Uses

 Land Management Monitoring understanding soil sealing trends
 Urban Planning impact of urbanization guiding sustainable development
 Environmental Studies Analyzing effects of impervious surfaces on water runoff pollution biodiversity
 Climate Change Research Investigating contribution urban areas to urban heat island effect

 Important Points

 EU Copernicus Program dataset produced under European Union's Copernicus program major initiative for Earth observation
 EEA Reference Grid data aligned with EEA reference grid for compatibility consistency

 Overall
 high-resolution imperviousness density dataset valuable resource for researchers environmental agencies planners provides comprehensive information on soil sealing across Europe deeper understanding of urbanization trends environmental impacts potential mitigation strategies
